Encore + Disable.description:
• Protect, Encore, and Disable are all used in conjunction to shut down slower foes and make them Struggle twice, while Moonblast provides the remaining damage. Encore also can be used to lock foes into status moves.
  • Generally, Protect is used on turn 1. In response to a foe's move, Encore can be used to continually lock it into a status move and slowly KO it with Moonblast. Encore can also lock the foe into a relatively weak attacking move; Alolan Ninetales can then use Protect into Disable into Encore again to force the foe to take two turns of Struggle.
  • Alternatively after using Protect on turn 1, Disable can be used on a Choice-locked Pokemon or a potentially dangerous move from a non-Choice-locked Pokemon. If the foe used that move again, Encore can be used right away, but if it used a different move, Protect is used again on turn 3, then Encore, then Protect, then Disable, and then Encore to then trigger two turns of Struggle.
  • If additional damage is needed, Moonblast can also be used on turn 2 assuming the foe will swap moves to avoid Disable.
  • Moonblast does the most damage after the foe's Struggle damage and has the added bonus of being able to KO Urshifu-S, which would otherwise bypass Protect thanks to its ability.
  • Leftovers provides passive healing over multiple turns, which lets Alolan Ninetales survive multiple hits and Struggles.
  • Maximum Speed lets Alolan Ninetales beat many slower Pokemon thanks to Encore and Disable while also Speed tying non-Speed Booster Walking Wake. Its HP investment allows Alolan Ninetales to survive unboosted Sylveon's Hyper Beam, and the Defense investment gives it good odds to survive Choice Scarf Great Tusk's Head Smash.
  • Alolan Ninetales struggles with faster Pokemon like Choice Scarf Haxorus and Choice Scarf Porygon-Z so it pairs well with bulky Pokemon that are able to survive hits from these foes, such as Metagross.
  • Alolan Ninetales also struggles with Pokemon that run multiple powerful moves that it can't survive, like Metagross, Skeledirge, and Life Orb Porygon-Z, and naturally pairs well with Pokemon like Urshifu-S and Ursaluna.

Clear Amulet.description:
• Eerie Impulse enables Zapdos to beat the likes of Primarina, Sylveon, non-Choice Band Hisuian Goodra, Spectrier, and Volcarona.
  • Clear Amulet helps Zapdos by blocking moves that lower Special Defense like Fake Tears from Sylveon, Acid Spray from Hisuian Goodra and Icy Wind from Primarina.
  • This EV spread allows Zapdos to survive Timid Choice Specs Spectrier's Hyper Beam and grants good chances of surviving Adamant Urshifu-R's Choice Band Surging Strikes.
  • Zapdos should always Eerie Impulse on the first turn against Volcanion, since Choice Scarf Volcanion can outspeed and 2HKO Zapdos if it uses Thunderbolt.
  • Zapdos struggles against physical attackers like Ursaluna and non-Choice Specs Hoopa-U. Pokemon that can outspeed and deal super effective damage to Zapdos like Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, and Jolly Choice Band Landorus-T also beat it. It is advised for Zapdos to be used with a Steel-type Pokemon like Corviknight to tackle these weaknesses.

Life Orb.description:
• Life Orb Zapdos is able to dish out high damage against several of the Water- and Fighting-type Pokemon in the tier, such as Primarina, both Urshifu formes, and Iron Valiant.
  • Hurricane deals with Urshifu-S, non-Substitute Ogerpon-W, and Iron Valiant.
  • Thunderbolt targets Urshifu-R, Volcanion, Galarian Moltres, and Corviknight.
  • Protect is helpful to deal with Custap Berry users such as Primarina.
  • Charge doubles the power of Thunderbolt while increasing Zapdos's Special Defense, dealing massive damage to Pokemon like Choice Specs Primarina and Assault Vest Azumarill.
  • U-turn is pivotal for dealing with non-bulky variants of Hoopa-U.
  • Maximum Special Attack investment allows Zapdos to deal with most Primarina sets without needing to use Charge, while the HP and Defense EVs help Zapdos survive a Choice Band Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow.
  • Zapdos can be often paired up with Water-type Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Primarina, as they can usually handle the Rock- and Ground-types that would usually pose a problem for it such as Donphan, Rhyperior, Landorus-T, and Hisuian Arcanine.

Custap Berry.description:
• Galarian Moltres uses its Custap Berry to win matchups against faster Pokemon.
  • Nasty Plot should be used to counter foes that set up against Galarian Moltres like Corviknight, Pecharunt, and Cresselia, as well as foes that may hold Weakness Policy, such as Metagross.
  • Endure enables Galarian Moltres to survive a lethal hit and activate its Custap Berry, allowing it to beat Pokemon like Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, and Custap Berry Skeledirge.
  • The defensive EVs allow Galarian Moltres to survive an Outrage from Choice Band Adamant Haxorus while also taking a Hyper Beam from Modest Porygon-Z.
  • Galarian Moltres struggles to beat specially bulky Pokemon such as Ursaluna and Assault Vest Hoopa-U, as well as Pokemon that resist its moves like Primarina, Raging Bolt, and Hisuian Goodra. Therefore, pairing it with Pokemon that can beat these threats such as Meowscarada, Corviknight, and Ogerpon-W will be beneficial.

Weakness Policy.description:
• Fiery Wrath lets Galarian Moltres easily clean up Ghost- and Psychic-type foes such as Spectrier, Cresselia, and Iron Crown.
  • Hurricane enables Galarian Moltres to handle Fighting- and Grass-type Pokemon like Great Tusk, Ogerpon-W, and Iron Valiant.
  • Nasty Plot allows Galarian Moltres to boost its Special Attack in order to compete with threats such as Take Heart Manaphy and specially defensive, Weakness Policy Iron Crown; it also lets it remove foes that are not OHKOed such as Pecharunt.
  • Air Slash gives Galarian Moltres a second STAB option for the Encore + Disable Iron Valiant matchup while also providing a more reliable way to hit foes. Alternatively, Taunt can be used to disrupt foes such as Ogerpon-W, Weakness Policy Iron Crown, and Serperior.
  • The EV spread allows Galarian Moltres to survive Spirit Break from Jolly Choice Band Iron Valiant and Moonblast from Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant.
  • Pair Galarian Moltres with Ground-types like Great Tusk, which covers its Electric weakness, protecting it from threats like Raging Bolt while also checking foes such as Choice Band Ursaluna and Tyranitar. In return, it checks Great Tusk answers like Ogerpon-W and Serperior. Steel-types like Iron Crown and Metagross are also good partners for Galarian Moltres, backing its Fairy weakness and checking foes such as Sylveon and Alolan Ninetales. In exchange, Galarian Moltres checks threats to these Steel-types such as Spectrier and Volcarona.

Stall.description:
• Chilling Water allows Azumarill to chip the foe down while reducing their Attack, giving it better chances versus Taunt Great Tusk.
  • Sap Sipper lures in Grass-types such as most offensive Choice Band Meowscarada.
  • The HP, Special Defense investment, and Calm nature allow Azumarill to defeat Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant most of the time.
  • Use Charm or Amnesia to lower the foe's damage output until Azumarill is forced to use Rest.

Life Orb.description:
• Scizor uses its strong defensive typing and unique offensive profile to carve itself a role as a setup pokemon with Swords Dance.
  • By using Life Orb over Choice Band, Scizor can gain important favorable matchups against Pecharunt, Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra, and non-Choice Band Metagross by using Swords Dance before attacking.
  • Bullet Punch is the move to use against foes such as Iron Valiant, Pecharunt, Alolan Ninetales, and Sylveon.
  • Bug Bite is a reliable STAB option, allowing Scizor to beat non-Fire Punch Hoopa-U, Meowscarada, non-Defense invested Ogerpon-W, and Cresselia.
  • Close Combat is used to defeat Hisuian Goodra and non-Speed invested Ursaluna after a Swords Dance as well as Porygon-Z.
  • If Scizor is looking to 2HKO the foe, it is generally better to use Swords Dance and then attack rather than attack twiceâ€”such as against Ursaluna and Pecharunt.
  • The defensive EVs allow Scizor to survive two Earthquakes from non-Choice Band Adamant Metagross after one turn of Life Orb recoil. The special bulk lets Scizor survive a Hyper Beam from Choice Specs Modest Porygon-Z.
  • 44 Speed EVs let Scizor outspeed uninvested Metagross, which allows it to beat Metagross via the sequence of Swords Dance, Bug Bite, and Bullet Punch without being outsped by Metagross's own Bullet Punch.
  • Scizor needs to be covered for its weaknesses against Fire-types such as Volcarona and Volcanion as well as physically bulky Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Corviknight, and both Urshifu formes. For this, it can be paired with Pokemon such as Primarina, Raging Bolt, and Alolan Ninetales to great effect.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band Scizor is a strong threat that can deal with some of the biggest metagame threats such as Iron Valiant, Hoopa-U, and Primarina.
  • Bullet Punch hits Alolan Ninetales, Diancie, Iron Valiant, and Primarina.
  • Bug Bite is important for non-Fire Punch Hoopa-U, Ogerpon-W, and Serperior.
  • Close Combat can hit opposing Steel-type Pokemon like non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra and Registeel.
  • Knock Off is good coverage for Ghost-type Pokemon such as Spectrier.
  • The HP EVs allow Scizor to survive a Choice Band Hyperspace Fury from Jolly Hoopa-U, while the Special Defense allows it to live a Hex from Life Orb Spectrier after one turn of burn damage and after its Life Orb has been removed by Knock Off.
  • Scizor naturally struggles against Fire-types such as Volcarona, Skeledirge, and Volcanion, as well as physical tanks such as Landorus-T, Ursaluna, and Urshifu-R, so strong special attackers like Walking Wake and Manaphy make for excellent partners.

Weakness Policy.description:
• Heavy Slam is for Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Whimsicott as well as light Pokemon such as Meowscarada and Porygon-Z.
  • Meteor Mash can be used for consistent damage, being particularly useful against heavy Rock- and Ice-type Pokemon
  • Bullet Punch is useful for securing KOs on faster Pokemon, Encore + Disable Pokemon such as Iron Valiant and Alolan Ninetales, and pinch Berry users such as Sneasler.
  • Earthquake is for Hisuian Goodra and Metagross mirror matchups.
  • Psychic Fangs is for Pecharunt and some Urshifu-R sets. It also helps break Reflect from Pokemon like Primarina and Kyurem.
  • Hone Claws allows Metagross to set up against Counter users like Hisuian Goodra, which cannot be OHKOed by Metagross's Earthquake, allowing it to OHKO Hisuian Goodra with +1 Earthquake.
  • The bulk EVs let Metagross survive Modest Choice Specs Kyurem's Earth Power and Adamant Choice Band Haxorus's Earthquake. The rest of the EVs are put into Attack.
  • If Metagross is not running Hone Claws to set up Attack against Counter Hisuian Goodra, it can chip away at Hisuian Goodra's HP with Bullet Punch, since Counter won't do much, then it can KO Hisuian Goodra when it's in Earthquake's KO range.
  • Since Metagross is weak to Fire-, Dark-, and Ground-type moves, a Water- or Fairy-type Pokemon like Manaphy or Primarina makes a good teammate.

Assault Vest.description:
• Heavy Slam is for Primarina, Iron Valiant, and Sylveon.
  • Bullet Punch lets Metagross deal with Encore + Disable Iron Valiant and KO Haxorus and Custap or Sitrus Berry Primarina after Heavy Slam.
  • Earthquake beats Iron Crown and is the best option Raging Bolt.
  • Psychic Fangs gives Metagross a better matchup against Pecharunt and Reflect Primarina, while Ice Punch gives Metagross the best odds against Assault Vest Landorus-T, and Life Orb Landorus.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Metagross to survive Knock Off from Jolly Choice Band Meowscarada. The Special Defense EVs allow Metagross to take 2 Thunderbolts from Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The remaining EVs are put into Attack to maximize odds against Choice Band Earthquake Haxorus.

Choice Band.description:
• Heavy Slam is used to defeat non-Custap Berry Primarina, while Meteor Mash allows Metagross to beat Kyurem. Both moves do well into Sylveon, Porygon-Z, and Azumarill.
  • Psychic Fangs is for Pecharunt and Iron Hands.
  • Bullet Punch targets Iron Valiant and Alolan Ninetales.
  • Earthquake hits Iron Crown, Hisuian Goodra, Registeel, and has favorable odds to beat most Raging Bolt sets.
  • The HP investment allows Metagross to survive Earthquake from Choice Band Iron Hands, while the Special Defense EVs allow it to survive Dark Pulse from Choice Specs Porygon-Z. The Attack EVs and an Adamant nature allow it to beat Encore + Disable Iron Valiant due to Struggle 2HKOing after a Bullet Punch.
  • An alternative EV spread of 232 HP / 236 Atk / 40 Def can be used to survive Focus Blast from Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Earthquake from Choice Band Haxorus. The remaining EVs are put in Attack for maximum damage output.
  • Choice Band Metagross should almost always use the move that does the most damage to an opposing Pokemon. Notable exceptions to this rule are Alolan Ninetales and Iron Valiant, as Bullet Punch allows Metagross to beat Encore + Disable variants of these Pokemon.

Stall.description:
• Registeel is one of the bulkiest Pokemon in the entire metagame. With its pure Steel typing, sky-high defenses, and access to Amnesia, Iron Defense, and Rest, it's easily able to stall a huge chunk of the metagame, including Alolan Ninetales, Primarina, Iron Crown, and non-Trick Metagross.
  • Body Press with Iron Defense is Registeel's best attacking move, allowing it to break through Pokemon such as Calm Mind Cresselia and Iron Defense Iron Crown.
  • Leftovers is used for general healing against the majority of the metagame, especially helping against Encore Primarina and Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • Air Balloon helps tremendously against Ground-type Pokemon such as both Ursaluna formes and Garchomp.
  • It's important to note that Registeel is crippled by its weakness to Fire- and Fighting-type attacks from the likes of Volcarona and both Urshifu formes, so Pokemon like Primarina and Volcanion make for good partners.
  • Registeel is also weak to a lot of common status moves such as Taunt from Raging Bolt and Corviknight, Encore from Ogerpon-W, and Curse from Pecharunt. Finding a Pokemon that can deal with these, such as Raging Bolt, Passho Berry Volcarona, or Choice Scarf Hisuian Arcanine, is crucial for Registeel to fit on a team.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band Garchomp looks for the opportunity to utilize its unique offensive profile to deal massive damage to slower targets such as Volcanion, Iron Hands, and Diancie.
  • Outrage can hit Spectrier, Air Balloon Volcanion, and Hoopa-U.
  • Earthquake hits Raging Bolt, non-Custap Berry Hisuian Goodra, and non-Weakness Policy variants of Metagross and Iron Crown.
  • Scale Shot is able to break Substitute from foes like Volcarona and Ogerpon-W.
  • Iron Head easily breaks through non-physically defensive Diancie, while Poison Jab is helpful for non-Kebia Berry Whimsicott.
  • The Special Defense EVs allow Garchomp to survive a Life Orb Hex from Spectrier after 1 turn of burn damage, while the Speed EVs are enough to outspeed non-Choice Scarf Hoopa-U.
  • Garchomp really appreciates Steel-type partners like Iron Crown and Scizor, as they are able to defeat the common Fairy- and Ice-type Pokemon that are usually able to defeat Garchomp, such as Iron Valiant, Alolan Ninetales, and Kyurem.

Life Orb.description:
• Garchomp's great typing and good Speed tier allow it to check many top threats in 1v1. Life Orb allows Garchomp to change its moves while giving it an important boost in power.
  • Outrage is Garchomp's strongest STAB move, allowing it to blast through neutral targets like Hoopa-U and Galarian Moltres, as well as other Dragon-types slower than it like non-Choice Scarf Haxorus and Kyurem.
  • Scale Shot breaks through Substitute from Pokemon like Volcarona, SubSeed Ogerpon-W, and Serperior, letting Garchomp outspeed and KO them with another move.
  • Earthquake allows Garchomp to pummel Pokemon weak to Ground such as Iron Hands, Hisuian Goodra, Iron Crown, and Volcanion.
  • Swords Dance allows Garchomp to break through Pokemon that would otherwise survive a hit from it and win the matchup, such as Air Balloon Pecharunt and Weakness Policy Metagross.
  • The EVs allow Garchomp to survive an uninvested Stored Power from boosted Weakness Policy Iron Crown after taking Life Orb recoil damage, and maximum Speed allows it to get the jump on the fairly competitive base 100 Speed tier, which includes Pokemon such as Volcarona and Manaphy, as well as all Iron Crown. The rest of the EVs are dumped into Attack.
  • Garchomp loses to Pokemon that can tank its STAB moves and KO it back such as Primarina, as well as faster Pokemon that threaten to OHKO it such as Dragapult, Chien-Pao, and Meowscarada. Teammates like Volcanion, Iron Hands, and Corviknight have great synergy with Garchomp because they cover its weaknesses.

Choice Specs.description:
• Porygon-Z is one of the strongest Pokemon in 1v1, being able to output a lot of damage with its Adaptability-boosted Hyper Beam, going through specially bulky Pokemon like non-Assault Vest Ursaluna, Landorus-T, and Sylveon, as long as the last one doesn't predict its Hyper Beam and goes for Endure.
  • Uproar can go through Substitute from Pokemon like Ogerpon-W, Entei, and Whimsicott.
  • Dark Pulse hits Ghost-types like Spectrier and Pecharunt.
  • Thunderbolt is Porygon-Z's best option against Corviknight.
  • Ice Beam damages both Landorus formes and Dragapult.
  • Trick can Choice-lock Pokemon like Pecharunt and Clear Amulet Cresselia and is usually combined with Recover, which helps Porygon-Z at healing off damage from low-damage foes like the previously mentioned Clear Amulet Cresselia.
  • Its HP is made to tank a Modest Volcanion's Overheat, while its Defense bulks an Ogerpon-W's Power Whip. Finally, its Speed lets it outspeed Modest Raging Bolt. The remaining EVs are put into Special Attack.
  • It's important to know when to use a STAB attack or when to use one of Porygon-Z's coverage moves; it's usually recommended to use Hyper Beam against bulky targets like Ursaluna over Ice Beam, since the Adaptability boost means a neutral STAB hit does as much damage as a super effective non-STAB hit.
  • Porygon-Z struggles against strong Fighting- and Steel-types that can easily take its attacks or outspeed it, such as Sneasler and Metagross, so Pokemon that can deal with them, like Landorus-T and Skeledirge, are excellent partners.

Life Orb.description:
• Life Orb Porygon-Z uses its freedom of moves to launch powerful attacks, which are backed by Nasty Plot boosts or the defenses from Substitute.
  • Hyper Beam is capable of OHKOing many Pokemon that do not resist it, such as non-Assault Vest Ursaluna, Raging Bolt, and non-Assault Vest Azumarill.
  • Nasty Plot lets Porygon-Z threaten an OHKO versus opposing Pokemon that would be able to tank Porygon-Z's unboosted Hyper Beam and KO it back, such as Maranga Berry Corviknight and Clear Amulet Cresselia.
  • Against Pokemon using the combination of Endure and Custap Berry that would be OHKOed by Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam, like Urshifu-S and Primarina, Porygon-Z can use Substitute when predicting Endure and fire off a Hyper Beam the next turn, while still being protected behind Substitute if Endure happens to work twice. However, it is advisable to be wary of Encore from Primarina.
  • Uproar lets Porygon-Z hit foes behind Substitute, such as Serperior and Whimsicott. It also gives Porygon-Z another Normal-type STAB move when the recharge turn of Hyper Beam is undesirable.
  • The Speed EVs help Porygon-Z outpace Modest Raging Bolt, and the HP and Defense EVs allow it to tank Choice Scarf Volcanion's Overheat and Jolly Ogerpon-W's Power Whip. The rest of the EVs are distributed into Special Attack.
  • This Porygon-Z set can struggle against faster Pokemon that can OHKO it, such as Haxorus and Meowscarada, so teammates like Corviknight or Primarina that can handle these Pokemon are well-warranted.
  • Like most Porygon-Z, Pokemon that can tank its Hyper Beam such as Steel-types like Hisuian Goodra, Assault Vest users like Ursaluna, and Ghost-types like Skeledirge are hard counters to it, so Pokemon like Choice Band Meowscarada and Urshifu-S are great partners for it.

Choice Scarf.description:
• A Choice Scarf allows Porygon-Z to outspeed many fast threats, such as non-Choice Scarf Haxorus, Meowscarada, and Chien-Pao, that would otherwise beat it.
  • Trick allows it to beat foes that try to stall it out, such as stall Manaphy and Agility Corviknight.
  • Ice Beam allows Porygon-Z to beat Garchomp and Landorus-T.
  • A Modest nature allows it to get consistent knockouts against Alolan Ninetales.
  • However, a Timid nature allows it to outspeed other Choice Scarf users and Speed-boosting threats, such as Speed Booster Energy Great Tusk.
  • Porygon-Z cannot break through bulky Steel-type Pokemon, like Iron Crown, Metagross and Hisuian Goodra, so its best partners are Pokemon with good matchups against those foes, such as Urshifu-S, Fire-types like Volcarona and Volcanion, and Ground-types like Landorus-T.

Clear Amulet.description:
• Cresselia can opt to run a Clear Amulet to prevent moves such as Hisuian Goodra's Acid Spray, Primarina's Icy Wind, and Sylveon's Fake Tears from disrupting its ability to set up and defeat the foe with Stored Power.
  • Stored Power becomes Cresselia's strongest move after it has used Calm Mind multiple times.
  • Calm Mind allows Cresselia to KO the foe with Stored Power.
  • Moonlight lets Cresselia regain HP when necessary to continue setting up with Calm Mind.
  • Reflect is usually used in the last moveslot to help Cresselia take strong physical attacks from Pokemon like Choice Band Ursaluna.
  • Future Sight can be used instead to defeat Encore + Disable Iron Valiant, which would otherwise be able to beat Cresselia.
  • Cresselia's Special Defense EVs are meant to take Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Kyurem twice with a Calm Mind boost, and its Speed EVs allow it to outspeed base 60 Speed Pokemon like Primarina and Hisuian Goodra. The rest of the EVs are placed in Defense.
  • Cresselia will never win a matchup against Dark-types like Urshifu-S and Meowscarada, while other Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Alolan Ninetales can lock Cresselia into an unfavorable move with Encore. Fairy-type Pokemon like Diancie and Sylveon can help Cresselia defeat the former foes, while faster Pokemon that do not mind Encore like Iron Moth can help Cresselia with the latter.

Choice Scarf.description:
• With use of a Choice Scarf, Cresselia can make use of the additional Speed and ability to disrupt Pokemon with Trick.
  • Cresselia outspeeds and uses Psychic to threaten to 2HKO on Pokemon like Annihilape, Iron Moth, and Urshifu-R.
  • Moonblast lets Cresselia to deal with Haxorus and less bulky variants of Urshifu-S.
  • Trick allows Cresselia to lock foes into a non-damaging move, such as Manaphy, Espathra, Clear Amulet Zapdos, and Serperior.
  • Moonlight allows Cresselia to heal itself in matchups where it can lock foes into a weaker attacking move, such as against Weakness Policy Iron Crown.
  • The defensive EVs allow Cresselia to survive two Choice Band Haxorus Outrages and two non-Choice Specs Volcanion Steam Eruptions with burn chip damage. The Speed EVs allow Cresselia to outpace Iron Moth with a Choice Scarf and Hisuian Goodra after a Trick, and the rest of the EVs are dumped into Special Attack.
  • Choice Scarf Cresselia is a great way to surprise players expecting Clear Amulet Cresselia, but without Reflect,it could struggle versus strong physical attackers like Ursaluna and Haxorus, so teammates like Corviknight and Urshifu-S are great partners.
  • Cresselia will inevitably lose against Dark-types like Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, and Galarian Moltres, so Fairy-type and Steel-type teammates like Alolan Ninetales and Heatran can cover these weaknesses.

Stall.description:
• Acid Armor should be used against Ursaluna, Metagross, and Choice Band Hoopa-U.
  • Take Heart is Manaphy's preferred way of boosting its Special Defense, as it allows Manaphy to bypass being burned by Will-O-Wisp + Hex Spectrier sets.
  • Scald's ability to burn can further hinder physical attackers with Swords Dance, such as some Garchomp and Haxorus sets.
  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Manaphy to survive Earth Power from Choice Specs Landorus twice after using Take Heart, while the Special Attack EVs allow Manaphy to OHKO it back with with a Take Heart-boosted Scald. The Speed EVs allow Manaphy to outspeed and defeat non-Icy Wind Primarina, and the remaining EVs are invested in Defense.
  • Combined with Acid Armor and Take Heart, Sitrus Berry further enhances Manaphy's ability to safely use these moves against Pokemon like Choice Band Dragapult. After boosting up its defensive stats, Manaphy can start using Scald to KO the foe.
  • Stall Manaphy struggles against strong Electric-type attackers, like Raging Bolt and Zapdos. It also struggles with Taunt and Encore users, such as Corviknight, Iron Valiant, and Alolan Ninetales. Teammates like both Landorus forms, Ursaluna, and Garchomp are appreciated, as they can deal with Electric-types, while teammates like Booster Energy Iron Crown can handle many of the Taunt and Encore users in the tier.

Custap Berry.description:
• Endure + Custap Berry allows Manaphy to consistently fire off Tail Glow-boosted attacks and take advantage of Choice Item attackers such as Iron Valiant and Urshifu-S that can overwhelm stall variants.
  • Hydro Pump is Manaphy's strongest available attack, significantly enabling it to beat any Metagross set with the sequence of Hydro Pump, Tail Glow, and Hydro Pump.
  • The accuracy of Surf makes it a more consistent option against the super effectively hit Ground- and Fire-types of the metagame and against some stall Pokemon such as Corviknight and Pecharunt. However, the loss of power is felt against neutral targets that Hyper Beam can struggle to KO such as Hoopa-U and Garchomp.
  • Hyper Beam is Manaphy's strongest special attack against Water-resistant targets, scoring KOs against targets such as Volcanion and frail Primarina variants after a Tail Glow boost.
  • The defensive EV spread allows Manaphy to survive two Sludge Waves from Modest Choice Specs Volcanion and the combination of two Psychic Fangs and a Bullet Punch from Adamant Metagross, enabling it to Tail Glow as needed. 16 Speed EVs let Manaphy outpace maximum Speed Modest Volcanion.
  • Volcarona is, despite intuition, an extremely dicey matchup for Manaphy. Quiver Dance and Substitute give it ample opportunities to avoid knocking Manaphy into Custap Berry range and eventually retaliate with a Swarm-boosted Bug Buzz. Partners such as Choice Band Meowscarada and Assault Vest Ursaluna can patch this weakness without sharing too many threats with Manaphy.
  • Manaphy is incapable of dealing with Pokemon that can OHKO it without fearing Hyper Beam, such as Meowscarada and Ogerpon-W. It also needs to be wary of Choice Scarf + Trick users such as Cresselia and Hoopa-U. Strong Dragon-type attackers such as Raging Bolt and Haxorus fare well against these threats.

Choice Specs.description:
• Darkrai uses its high Speed and Special Attack with its vast movepool to blast through a wide range of opposing Pokemon.
  • Dark Pulse is Darkrai's most consistent move, beating Pokemon such as non-Assault Vest Metagross, Pecharunt, Cresselia, and non-specially defensive Iron Crown, with the added benefit of a flinch chance.
  • Ice Beam lets Darkrai defeat Landorus-T, non-Choice Scarf Meowscarada, Garchomp, and Zapdos.
  • Thunder is Darkrai's best option against Corviknight, Urshifu-R, Manaphy, and non-Assault Vest Volcanion.
  • Focus Blast helps Darkrai against non-Choice Scarf Kyurem, Zarude, Roaring Moon, and non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z.
  • Sludge Bomb assists versus non-specially defensive Ogerpon-W, Whimsicott, and non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Valiant.
  • 4 Special Defense EVs give Darkrai slightly better odds against a Hyper Beam from Life Orb Spectrier.
  • Darkrai struggles to break through specially bulky Steel-, Fairy-, and Dragon-types, like Hisuian Goodra and Sylveon, even when it is using super effective moves. Pokemon that beat these, such as Landorus-T, Sneasler, and Corviknight, are robust partners.

Choice Band.description:
• Bolstering a massive Attack stat, Haxorus uses its natural strength combined with a Choice Band to overwhelm its foes.
  • Outrage is Haxorus's strongest option, threatening KOs on many Pokemon that don't resist it, such as Pecharunt, Volcarona, and Volcanion.
  • Scale Shot allows Haxorus to break through Substitutes created by SubSeed Pokemon such as Serperior.
  • First Impression allows Haxorus to get the jump on Meowscarada and Chien-Pao.
  • For the last move, Close Combat can be used to threaten KOs on Steel-types such as Heatran and Hisuian Goodra. Iron Tail can be used to KO Diancie and Sylveon. Finally, Poison Jab can OHKO Whimsicott.
  • Unnerve is Haxorus's generally preferred ability to prevent Pokemon that use resistance berries such as Haban Berry Raging Bolt and Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra and Urshifu-S from preventing an OHKO. However, Mold Breaker can be used to break through Hisuian Avalugg's Sturdy.
  • As Choice Band Haxorus is locked into a move after it selects one, it is advised to select the move that does the most damage.
  • Steel-types that don't care for Haxorus's coverage moves such as Corviknight and Iron Crown can defeat Haxorus, while faster Ice- and Fairy-type Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Kyurem and Iron Valiant can threaten a KO on Haxorus. Good Fire- and Steel-type partners like Volcanion and one's own Iron Crown can help Haxorus in these poor matchups.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Haxorus looks to outspeed and KO a variety of different Pokemon with high-Base Power moves while using Unnerve to prevent Custap Berry on Hoopa-U and Haban Berry on Raging Bolt and Garchomp from being activated.
  • Outrage allows Haxorus to OHKO most other Dragon-types like Raging Bolt and Dragapult.
  • Close Combat can hit Porygon-Z and Choice Specs Darkrai.
  • The remaining moveslots can be tailored to beat specific notable Pokemon in the tier. Rock Slide can be used to target Volcarona. X-Scissor hits Hoopa-U, Meowscarada, and both offensive and SubSeed Ogerpon-W without the downside of confusion chances from Outrage. Iron Tail hits Diancie and Alolan Ninetales. Earthquake can hit non-Air Balloon Heatran.
  • Adamant maximizes Choice Scarf Haxorus's damage output, which can be important for matchups versus bulky Porygon-Z, while a Jolly nature gives Haxorus maximum Speed to outpace Choice Scarf Porygon-Z.
  • Haxorus struggles with most Steel- and Fairy-types like Hisuian Goodra and Primarina as well as physically bulky Pokemon even if they don't resist Outrage like Landorus-T and Ursaluna, so it pairs well with Pokemon like Iron Hands and Air Balloon Volcanion that can deal with them.

Life Orb.description:
• Volcarona is one of the stronger Pokemon in 1v1 thanks to its powerful STAB moves and access to one of the strongest setup moves in the game in Quiver Dance, which allows it to break past several important Pokemon such as Alolan Ninetales, Porygon-Z, and Iron Crown.
  • Bug Buzz threatens Hoopa-U and Cresselia. Bug Buzz also goes through Substitute to threaten the likes of Serperior and Whimsicott.
  • Overheat can threaten Scizor, Iron Crown, and Metagross.
  • Substitute is generally helpful against Pokemon that utilize low-accuracy moves to hit Volcarona, like Galarian Moltres and Zapdos, or for letting Volcarona get into Swarm range.
  • The EV spread lets Volcarona outspeed Hoopa-U while surviving the strongest Choice Scarf attacks from it; more specifically, the bulk allows it to survive an Adamant Hoopa-U's Hyperspace Fury after Life Orb recoil, with the rest of the EVs going into Special Attack.
  • Volcarona tends to struggle against Pokemon that threaten to OHKO it, such as Primarina, Landorus-T, and Ursaluna, so Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Kyurem make for good partners.

Choice Band.description:
• Earthquake is for Raging Bolt, Iron Crown, and non-Choice Scarf Metagross.
  • Outrage is for Haxorus, Dragapult, and Garchomp.
  • U-turn makes the matchup against Hoopa-U reliable, as Earthquake does not OHKO bulkier sets.
  • Rock Tomb lets Landorus-T deal with Volcarona and Choice Specs Zapdos, while Fly allows it to beat offensive Ogerpon-W and gives it another option against specially defensive Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • The HP EVs allow Landorus-T to tank Outrage from Jolly Choice Band Dragapult, while the Special Defense EVs allow it to take Overheat from Timid Life Orb Volcarona. The Speed EVs let Landorus-T outspeed non-Choice Scarf Hoopa-U. The remaining EVs are invested in Attack.
  • Unless trying to outplay Custap Berry foes, such as Custap Berry Hoopa-U, for which Landorus-T has an option between using U-turn and Outrage, it is almost always recommended for Landorus-T to use its strongest attack against its foe.

Life Orb.description:
• Earthquake hits Hisuian Goodra, Raging Bolt, Tyranitar, Skeledirge, and non-Air Balloon Pecharunt.
  • Bulk Up helps against Iron Hands, Ursaluna, and Choice Band Annihilape.
  • Hammer Arm is for Ursaluna, Assault Vest Ursaluna-B, and Air Balloon Heatran.
  • Smack Down helps against Corviknight and Air Balloon Pecharunt, while U-turn increases Landorus-T's reliability against Hoopa-U. Protect can be used to prevent Custap Berry Skeledirge's Blast Burn from OHKOing Landorus-T with Blaze. Outrage can be utilized to deal with Haxorus and non-Haban Berry Garchomp.
  • The Speed EVs allow Landorus-T to outspeed Modest Raging Bolt. The remaining EVs are invested in HP.
  • Landorus-T can use an alternative set with an EV spread of 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe and a Jolly nature. This spread lets Landorus-T outspeed and OHKO most Porygon-Z and Hoopa-U sets, though Landorus-T has to carry U-turn for the latter to ensure an OHKO on bulkier sets.
  • Against Ursaluna, Landorus-T should use Bulk Up until Hammer Arm can OHKO it, as Avalanche does not double in power if Landorus-T does not damage Ursaluna.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest is useful to win against foes that Landorus-T doesn't usually beat. Assault Vest can also help it survive attacks from other special attackers like Raging Bolt, non-Ice Beam Porygon-Z, and Steam Eruption from non-Choice Specs Volcanion.
  • Outrage is a coverage move that helps Landorus-T against Dragon-types like Dragapult and Haxorus.
  • U-turn beats Hoopa-U.
  • Bulldoze allows Landorus-T to lower the Speed of the opposing Pokemon, which can help against Iron Crown.
  • Landorus-T struggles against Pokemon that are able to OHKO it, like Ninetales-Alola and Chien-Pao, as well as Pokemon that are able to use an Ice-type coverage move like Choice item Iron Valiant and Meowscarada, and Pokemon that can tank a hit and OHKO it back like Primarina, or ones that aren't affected by any moves it can run, like Corviknight.
  • Thus, Pokemon such as Iron Crown or Volcanion can be used alongside Landorus-T to cover those threats.

Life Orb.description:
• Coupled with Pixilate and Life Orb, Hyper Beam and Hyper Voice both become powerful STAB moves, destroying most Dragon-, Dark- and Fighting-types, such as Raging Bolt, Galarian Moltres, Darkrai, Iron Valiant, and both Urshifu forms. In addition, Hyper Beam OHKOes Landorus, Iron Hands, Assault Vest Great Tusk, and non-Assault Vest Azumarill and Rhyperior; the combination of the two moves can defeat Bellibolt.
  • Thanks to the additional power and the defensive boost offered by Calm Mind, Sylveon can beat Manaphy, Spectrier, Espathra, non-Clear Amulet Zapdos, Assault Vest Ursaluna-B, Weakness Policy Primarina, and Calm Mind Raging Bolt.
  • The Special Defense drop of Fake Tears is useful against Assault Vest Ursaluna and Azumarill, whereas Quick Attack allows Sylveon to finish off Custap Berry users like Primarina, Galarian Moltres, and Porygon-Z.
  • The given EV spread lets Sylveon OHKO Alolan Ninetales with Hyper Beam and improves its matchup against Choice Band Urshifu-R. Indeed, Jolly Urshifu-R variants can't OHKO Sylveon, while Adamant versions only have low chances of KOing it.
  • Sylveon is unable to eliminate Steel-, Poison-, and Fire-types such as Iron Crown, Metagross, Pecharunt, Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Skeledirge. Therefore, teammates with a favorable matchup against them, like the Ursaluna formes and the Landorus formes, are appreciated.
  • Sylveon also can't face strong attackers such as non-Choice Specs Hoopa-U, boosted Porygon-Z, Ursaluna, and Donphan, so it needs partners like Corviknight and Choice Band Meowscarada to handle them.

Custap Berry.description:
• Hyper Voice is notably a strong pick for Sylveon against Substitute users such as Whimsicott, Zapdos, and Spectrier, whereas Hyper Beam is a powerful option to get rid of frailer foes, including Raging Bolt, Meowscarada, and Porygon-Z, and offers a great attack on the turn where Sylveon's Custap Berry activates. Against bulkier targets like Primarina, Ursaluna-B, and Ogerpon-W, Sylveon should either use Fake Tears or Hyper Voice, then take enough damage to get into Custap Berry range and finish them with Hyper Beam.
  • Thanks to Fake Tears, Sylveon can win some tricky matchups against Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Bellibolt, and non-Clear Amulet Manaphy.
  • The combination of Endure + Custap Berry lets Sylveon turn the tide against the likes of Ogerpon-W, non-Assault Vest Hoopa-U, Choice Band Meowscarada, and Porygon-Z. Sylveon should usually use Endure on the first turn against the aforementioned Pokemon.
  • Thanks to the given EV spread, Sylveon can tank two Ice Shards from Adamant Choice Band Chien-Pao, allowing it to always be able to use Endure on the first turn against Chien-Pao while still having high enough Special Defense for Timid Choice Specs Landorus. The remaining EVs are put in Special Attack to increase its damage output.
  • Fire- and Water-types such as Volcarona, Volcanion, and Ogerpon-W appreciate Sylveon's ability to deal with Dragon-types, while, in return, they can beat threatening Steel- and Fire-types like Metagross, Iron Crown, Corviknight, Skeledirge, and opposing Volcarona.
  • Sylveon usually struggles against Poison-types, notably Pecharunt, Iron Moth, and Fezandipiti, so it appreciates having Steel- and Psychic-type teammates such as Hisuian Goodra, Iron Crown, and Hoopa-U.

• Hisuian Goodra is one of the most solid Pokemon in SV 1v1 thanks to its unique typing of Steel and Dragon, allowing to beat Pokemon such as Raging Bolt without fearing much back from them, while also dealing with Fairy-type Pokemon such as Primarina.
  • Draco Meteor hits Dragon-type Pokemon like Kyurem, on top of targets like Raging Bolt and Volcanion after an Acid Spray.
  • Acid Spray is one of the key points of this set, as its 100% chance of dropping opponents Special Defense helps Hisuian Goodra in boosting its attacks against Pokemon like Primarina, as long as the first one doesn't carry Dragon Energy.
  • Sludge Wave allows it to deal with Primarina more easily.
  • Flash Cannon can deal with other Fairy-type Pokemon such as Diancie and Alolan Ninetales.
  • Endure allows Hisuian Goodra to live any hit that would've OHKOed it, then activate Custap Berry on the next turn, and fire back with its powerful Draco Meteor.
  • Sap Sipper is a useful tool for Hisuian Goodra as it allows it to easily deal with Whimsicott and Serperior.
  • Its EV spread allows it to live two Moonblasts from Choice Specs Primarina while maximizing HP, with the remaining EVs going into Special Attack.
  • Hisuian Goodra can struggle against Fighting- and Ground-types like both Urshifu formes, Great Tusk, and Ursaluna, so Pokemon that can deal with these, like Primarina, Serperior, and Manaphy make for great partners.

Chople Berry.description:
• Draco Meteor is for Dragon-type Pokemon without defensive items like Haban Berry and Assault Vest, such as Raging Bolt, Dragapult, and non-Choice Specs Kyurem.
  • Heavy Slam deals with Fairy-type Pokemon such as Whimsicott, Diancie, and Primarina.
  • Acid Spray is used to drop Special Defense, and the combination of Acid Spray + Draco Meteor can KO Pokemon like Porygon-Z, non-Assault Vest or non-Choice Specs Volcanion, non-Clear Amulet Pecharunt, and Life Orb Spectrier.
  • Counter is for Pokemon with strong physical moves that don't OHKO Hisuian Goodra, usually Choice Band users like Urshifu-R, Iron Valiant, Chien-Pao, and Meowscarada.
  • Hisuian Goodra's EVs maximize HP so that it can tank a Choice Band Close Combat from Iron Valiant and both Urshifu formes while surviving two +1 Life Orb Hexes from Spectrier after chip damage from burn. Its Attack allows it to always OHKO non-bulky sets of Iron Valiant, with the rest of the EVs in Special Attack.
  • Because of Sap Sipper, Hisuian Goodra can win against SubSeed Pokemon such as Whimsicott, Serperior, and Ogerpon-W.
  • Against Encore + Disable Pokemon like Iron Valiant and Alolan Ninetales, it is necessary to use Heavy Slam turn 1 and switch to Acid Spray on turn 2. Using Acid Spray turn 1 will lose the matchup, as it does not threaten a 2HKO on these foes.
  • Since Hisuian Goodra struggles against Ursaluna, Landorus-T, and Donphan, Pokemon like Primarina, Urshifu-R, and Manaphy make good teammates.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band Hisuian Goodra looks to use its inferior but still solid Attack stat to surprise and defeat foes such as Hoopa-U, opposing Hisuian Goodra, and Volcarona.
  • Heavy Slam deals tons of damage to Diancie, Sylveon, and Primarina.
  • Skitter Smack is extremely useful for the Hoopa-U matchup, as it can OHKO even the most bulky variants of it. It's also helpful for non-Focus Blast Iron Crown, as it means it's difficult for Iron Crown to break through.
  • Earthquake hits important threats such as non-Counter Hisuian Goodra, Volcarona, Metagross, and non-Air Balloon Heatran.
  • The EV spread allows Hisuian Goodra to live a Choice Band Hyperspace Fury from Hoopa-U as well as two Life Orb Moonblasts from Primarina.
  • Since Ground- and Fighting-type attacks are quite common in the metagame from Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Haxorus, Ursaluna, and Landorus-T, Pokemon with typings that are quite good against these like Primarina are advised for teammates.

• Hyperspace Fury targets Psychic-types like Iron Crown and Metagross as well as Ghost-types such as Skeledirge and Pecharunt.
  • Gunk Shot deals with Fairy-types such as non-Kebia Berry Azumarill, non-Custap Berry Primarina, and Sylveon.
  • Hoopa-U's last two moveslots are highly customizable. Zen Headbutt can handle Poison-types like Okidogi. Drain Punch allows Hoopa-U to beat Darkrai. Fire Punch beats non-Occa Berry Scizor, while Ice Punch is for non-Weakness Policy Galarian Moltres as well as Landorus; however, it should be noted that both Landorus formes can run U-turn to beat Hoopa-U.
  • Hoopa-U's HP and Special Defense EVs are to survive a Timid Choice Scarf Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam, with the rest put in Attack and Speed.
  • Hoopa-U can utilize an alternative EV spread of 240 HP / 252 Def / 16 Spe with an Impish nature to survive strong physical attacks from Meowscarada while also outspeeding Adamant Donphan and Iron Hands.
  • Hoopa-U struggles against Fairy- and Bug-type foes such as Iron Valiant and Volcarona, so Fire-type teammates such as Skeledirge and Volcanion are appreciated. Fast Choice Band Hoopa-U also struggles against faster physical attackers such as Ogerpon-W and Meowscarada; therefore, physical walls as partners like Pecharunt are helpful.

Choice Specs.description:
• Psychic Noise is used over Psychic, as it allows Hoopa-U to defeat Serperior.
  • Dark Pulse should be used against non-Disable Spectrier and Cresselia.
  • Thunderbolt allows Hoopa-U to beat Corviknight.
  • Grass Knot is for Rhyperior, while Focus Blast is strong into Hisuian Goodra.
  • Choice Specs Hoopa-U can use 52 HP EVs to survive Leaf Storm twice from non-Special Attack-invested Serperior. Additionally, 252 Speed EVs without a boosting nature allow Hoopa-U to outspeed Corviknight while also having the best odds against opposing Choice Specs Hoopa-U. The rest of the EVs and a Modest nature allow for maximum damage output.
  • Choice Specs Hoopa-U can also use an EV spread of 228 HP / 252 Def / 12 SpA / 16 Spe to survive Giga Impact from Assault Vest Ursaluna while outspeeding Adamant Donphan. The remaining EVs and a Modest nature allow for the best damage output while running this spread.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Hyperspace Fury should be used against Cresselia, Dragapult, Serperior, and Pecharunt.
  • Gunk Shot is for non-defensive Ogerpon-W and Meowscarada.
  • Focus Blast is for Chien-Pao and Porygon-Z.
  • Thunderbolt is for non-Maranga Berry Corviknight, while Rock Tomb is for non-bulky Volcarona.
  • The HP and Special Defense EVs let Hoopa-U survive Timid Choice Scarf Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam. Maximum Speed EVs and a Jolly nature allow Hoopa-U to outspeed Modest Choice Scarf Porygon-Z and Dragapult and Speed tie opposing Choice Scarf Hoopa-U. The remaining EVs are in Attack.
  • Hoopa-U should use the strongest move it has in most cases. Other cases include trying to outplay a potential Custap Berry foe like Custap Berry Porygon-Z, picking a more accurate move in case two moves can KO, and using Hyperspace Fury to bypass Substitute and Protect.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest Hoopa-U is a strong check to powerful special attackers like Porygon-Z and Volcanion.
  • Psychic Noise deals strong damage to Fighting-types like Iron Valiant, as well as threatening victories against Pokemon that make use of their recovery to win battles, such as stall Azumarill and Pecharunt.
  • Knock Off allows Hoopa-U to damage other Psychic-types like Cresselia and Iron Crown while removing important items like Custap Berry from Sylveon and Life Orb from Porygon-Z that could otherwise threaten Hoopa-U's ability to win the matchup.
  • Gunk Shot threatens KOs against Fairy-type Pokemon like Primarina and Sylveon.
  • Drain Punch is used to defeat various Pokemon that Hoopa-U may want to recover HP from, such as non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra and Porygon-Z.
  • The HP and Special Defense EVs are used to bulk +2 Life Orb Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam after Knock Off, and the Speed EVs outspeed neutral-natured maximum investment base 50 speed Pokemon like Donphan. The rest of the EVs are dumped into Attack.
  • This set aims to act as a blanket check to many special attackers in the tier, such as Primarina and Porygon-Z. However, Assault Vest Hoopa-U may lack the immediate fire power to deal enough damage to Pokemon like Corviknight or have enough Speed to defeat other Pokemon like faster Hoopa-U.

Custap Berry.description:
• Psychic hits Poison-types like Pecharunt and Fighting-types like Urshifu-R, while Hyperspace Fury hits foes like Dragapult and Skeledirge.
  • Hyperspace Fury is useful because it ignores Spiky Shield from Ogerpon-W and Protect from other Custap Berry Pokemon.
  • Gunk Shot helps against Grass-types like Leech Seed Ogerpon-W and Whimsicott. It can also reliably hit Dark-types like Darkrai.
  • The HP and Defense investment helps Hoopa-U survive a Play Rough from Ogerpon-W, and the Speed EVs let it outspeed Donphan, but be careful because it has a chance to OHKO Hoopa-U with Earthquake. The remaining EVs are in Attack for maximum damage.
  • Against SubSeed Ogerpon-W, always use Gunk Shot until it is in range of Hyperspace Fury.
  • Pair Hoopa-U with something that can win against bulky Steel-types like Corviknight, Hisuian Goodra, and Registeel because Hyperspace Fury doesn't do enough damage, and they can KO it in return or use Iron Defense. Some good Pokemon for role that are Smack Down Landorus, Ursaluna-B, and Volcarona.

Air Balloon.description:
• Volcanion uses Air Balloon to lure Ground-types, such as Landorus-T, Ursaluna and Donphan, while maintaining its strong matchups against Fairy- and Steel-type Pokemon.
  • Steam Eruption is Volcanion's most consistent STAB move. It hits the Ground-types that Air Balloon lures as well as Fire Types like Volcarona and Skeledirge.
  • Sludge Wave hits Primarina, which Volcanion walls with its ability and typing, super effectively. It also offers an essential second coverage option against Encore + Disable Alolan Ninetales and Iron Valiant.
  • Substitute tanks Ursaluna's Giga Impact and Choice Band Donphan's Head Smash, allowing Volcanion to attack freely after the recharge turn and recoil damage respectively.
  • The defensive EVs allow Volcanion to survive Adamant Choice Band Meowscarada's Giga Impact and Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Focus Blast. 96 Speed EVs allow Volcanion to outpace Adamant Ursaluna while maximizing its Special Attack. 232 Speed EVs let it outpaces fast Corviknight.
  • It should be noted that while Air Balloon flips a lot of matchups, it does not automatically beat all powerful Earthquake users. Garchomp and Haxorus are both still highly favored to win against Volcanion.
  • Iron Valiant is a classic partner with Volcanion. Iron Valiant covers the Dragon-types that Volcanion struggles with, while Volcanion covers the Steel and Fairy-types that Iron Valiant loses to. Air Balloon lets it synergizes particularly well, as it covers the few Ground-types that can present issues for Iron Valiant without an offensive set.
  • Despite its typing, Volcanion can struggle against Iron Crown without the help of a stat-boosting item like Assault Vest or Life Orb. Therefore, Dark-types such as Hoopa-U and Urshifu-S make for strong partners.

Choice Specs.description:
• Volcanion uses its unique typing and high Special Attack to carve its role as a strong, bulky attacker.
  • Steam Eruption is a strong STAB move to OHKO Pokemon such as Volcarona, Skeledirge, and non-Speed invested Ursaluna.
  • Overheat hits Corviknight, Metagross, Meowscarada, and non-specially defensive Iron Crown.
  • Sludge Wave is solid coverage to use versus Primarina, Ogerpon-W, Sylveon, and non-Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • Hyper Beam hits Haxorus for an OHKO.
  • The defensive EVs allow Volcanion to survive an Earthquake from Choice Band Haxorus while also taking Sylveon's Hyper Beam after Fake Tears.
  • Volcanion struggles to defeat Dragon-types such as Raging Bolt and Hisuian Goodra. It can therefore be paired with Pokemon such as Iron Valiant, Iron Crown, and Sylveon to cover these weaknesses.

Life Orb.description:
• The combination of Life Orb and Flame Charge allows Volcanion to consistently beat Iron Crown, chipping Weakness Policy sets into Overheat range and scouting against Assault Vest Metal Burst sets. Flame Charge is also useful against SubSeed users such as Ogerpon-W and Serperior.
  • The defensive EVs allow it to survive Adamant Choice Band Meowscarada's Giga Impact and Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Focus Blast. 232 Speed EVs let it outpace Ogerpon-W after a Flame Charge boost as well as fast Corviknight .
  • Volcanion's powerful STAB combination hits prominent Steel and Fire-types such as Metagross and Volcarona.
  • Sludge Wave is necessary Water-types with a dual typing such as Primarina and Ogerpon-W.
  • Combined with its natural ability to check Fairy- and Fire- type Pokemon, a Volcanion set specialized for the most threatening Steel-types in the tier is most appreciated by Fairy-type Pokemon such as Alolan Ninetales and, in particular, Iron Valiant. Offensive Iron Valiant sets can check various threats to Volcanion such as Hisuian Goodra and Hoopa-U. Alolan Ninetales easily handles Ground-types like Landorus-T and Garchomp.

• This spread allows Primarina to beat Pokemon that it usually can't, such as Timid Weakness Policy Iron Crown and non-Agility Corviknight.
  • Generally, the sequence against Iron Crown is to use Encore on the first turn to lock it into using Calm Mind, then use Icy Wind twice to lower its Speed so Primarina can lock it with Encore back into Calm Mind in the following turn, then use Moonblast once and use Encore once again, then alternate between Hydro Cannon and Encore, keeping the recharge turn and Life Orb damage in mind. In case Iron Crown uses Tachyon Cutter on the first turn, it activates Torrent on turn two, which allows Primarina to OHKO it with Hydro Cannon.
  • This spread allows Primarina to survive a Poison Jab or Sludge Wave from Adamant Choice Band Urshifu formes and Timid Life Orb Landorus and then OHKO them with Moonblast or Icy Wind, respectively.
  • An alternative EV spread of 56 HP / 192 Def / 8 SpA / 252 Spe lets Primarina bulk Jolly Choice Band Urshifu formes' attacks but not Adamant Choice Band variants, dropping that matchup in order to gain a more consistent Iron Crown matchup, since Primarina's higher Speed stat means it can outspeed Iron Crown after a single Icy Wind and threaten Special Attack Booster Energy variants with a Torrent-boosted Hydro Cannon if Iron Crown decides to go for an attack. This spread also allows Primarina to outspeed Ursaluna and OHKO it with Hydro Cannon.
  • Against Spectrier, use Encore on turn one. If Spectrier attacks on turn one, use Hydro Cannon on turn two. If Spectrier uses a status move, use Icy Wind thrice with the main spread or twice with the alternative spread, then use Encore to lock Spectrier into a status move while dealing damage with Moonblast and Hydro Cannon.
  • Moonblast allows Primarina to beat commonly used Dragon- and Fighting-type Pokemon, such as Roaring Moon, Dragapult, the Urshifu formes, and Iron Valiant.
  • Since Primarina is weak to Poison-type or STAB attacks from foes such as Sneasler, Pecharunt, Volcanion, Hoopa, Raging Bolt, and Ogerpon-Wellspring, it is suggested to pair Primarina with Dragon- and Steel-type Pokemon such as Roaring Moon, Iron Crown, and Metagross to form the well-known Dragon / Fairy / Steel core.

Weakness Policy.description:
• Primarina is one of the strongest Pokemon in 1v1 thanks to its unique typing, important role compression, and variety of sets.
  • The combination of Weakness Policy and Charm or Reflect allows Primarina to take care of slower threats that aim to defeat it with their super effective moves, such as Iron Hands with Supercell Slam and Donphan and Ursaluna with Gunk Shot.
  • Charm can work multiple times, which can help if Primarina is trying to stall a foe or to get to Torrent range to fire off an extremely strong Hydro Cannon, while Reflect can take care of Clear Amulet Pokemon, an item these Pokemon can run to be a hard counter to the Charm variant.
  • Hydro Cannon can KO Ursaluna and Donphan after a boost from Weakness Policy on the former and a Draining Kiss on the latter.
  • Draining Kiss and Moonblast can threaten both Urshifu formes, and while Draining Kiss is especially helpful for the Donphan matchup, Moonblast can also be utilized for overall damage against Haxorus.
  • Calm Mind lets it set up in front of potential threats like Clear Amulet Cresselia.
  • Thanks to its huge investment in Speed, Primarina can outrun Ursaluna, Iron Hands, and Donphan while threatening KOs in return, with its Defense and HP maximized for the best rolls against Choice Band Haxorus.
  • Primarina should be used in teams where its weaknesses to Grass, Electric, and Poison are patched up, so it really likes pairing with Dragon-types like Raging Bolt, Steel-types like Corviknight and Hisuian Goodra, or Psychic-types like Hoopa-U and Iron Crown.

Custap Berry.description:
• Custap Berry Primarina looks to flip matchups it usually loses, like Choice Specs Kyurem, and provide reliability against Landorus-T; it achieves this by surviving attacks it would normally be OHKOed by with Endure, moving first on the second turn with Custap Berry, and firing back with its extremely strong attacks.
  • Hydro Cannon can hit both Ursaluna formes, Skeledirge, and Great Tusk, and it's boosted by Torrent if Primarina is at or below 1/3rd of its maximum HP, which is often reached when Primarina loses enough health for Custap Berry to activate the following turn, allowing it to outspeed and wash out these Pokemon with little issue.
  • Moonblast hits Haxorus, Iron Valiant, and both Urshifu formes.
  • Encore helps against Pokemon that attempt to set up on or attack Primarina like non-Choice Scarf or Specs Porygon-Z and Weakness Policy Metagross, while Calm Mind helps it boost against the likes of Passho Berry Volcarona.
  • Primarina's HP and Defense EVs help it survive a Timid Life Orb Landorus's Sludge Wave as well as an Adamant Choice Band Urshifu's Poison Jab, with the remaining EVs going into Special Attack.
  • Primarina finds itself struggling against Grass-, Electric- and Poison-types like offensive Ogerpon-W, Raging Bolt, and Pecharunt, so it appreciates having partners that can deal with these threats like Hoopa-U and Iron Crown.

Choice Specs.description:
• Hydro Cannon is Primarina's strongest attack and should be used against both Landorus formes, non-Custap Berry Skeledirge, and non-Substitute Volcarona.
  • Moonblast defeats Haxorus and Garchomp.
  • Energy Ball should be used against Rhyperior and is Primarina's best way to deal with non-Sap Sipper Azumarill.
  • Liquid Voice + Uproar makes Primarina defeat Registeel and gives it an option to defeat Custap Berry Skeledirge and Substitute Volcarona, while Psychic Noise + Torrent allows it to beat Whimsicott reliably. Torrent Primarina is also more consistent agaisnt bulkier Choice Specs Hoopa sets, as Moonblast does not always OHKO them.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Primarina to survive Earthquake from Choice Band Landorus-T, while the Special Defense EVs allow it to survive Sludge Wave from Timid Choice Specs Landorus.
  • Choice Specs Primarina, unlike other Primarina sets, loses to Encore + Disable Iron Valiant sets, so it is important to use a teammate that can defeat the aforementioned sets.

Maranga Berry.description:
• Iron Defense lets Corviknight boost its Defense against physical attackers like non-Thunder Punch Meowscarada, non-Trick Choice Scarf Metagross, and Haxorus to then outheal them with Roost.
  • Taunt lets Corviknight beat setup Pokemon like Iron Crown, Calm Mind Primarina, and Registeel.
  • Running Agility on Corviknight over Body Press can allow it beat Curse Pecharunt, Encore + Disable Alolan Ninetales, and some Icy Wind variants of Primarina.
  • Compared to Agility, Body Press has much less chances of getting hit by a critical hit, allows Corviknight to beat Chien-Pao while reducing the chances of getting flinched, and is less forced to use Roost more than it has to against Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B thanks to not worrying about Roost letting it get hit by a Ground-type move or critical hit.
  • Maranga Berry allows Corviknight to beat special attackers such as Kyurem, Primarina, and Espathra.
  • Corviknight can reduce its chances of receiving a critical hit with Pressure, which is valuable on a stall Pokemon because its effect gives foes half as many chances to land a critical hit.
  • The 200 speed EVs allow Corviknight to outspeed neutral-natured base 60 Speed Pokemon such as Choice Specs Primarina and Sylveon and prevent them from setting up with Taunt, and the rest of the EVs are put into its defenses.
  • Good partners to Corviknight are Ground- and Dragon-types like Ursaluna and Roaring Moon that can beat the Fire- and Electric-types that threaten Corviknight super effectively.

Choice Band.description:
• Outrage is for non-Choice Scarf and non-Haban Berry Dragon-type Pokemon and can be used to deal massive STAB damage against Pokemon such as Volcarona, Porygon-Z, and Zapdos.
  • Dragon Darts is specifically used to break Substitute from Pokemon like Espathra.
  • Phantom Force covers Ghost-type Pokemon like Spectrier, Pecharunt, Annihilape, and non-physically defensive Skeledirge.
  • U-turn deals with physically defensive Hoopa-U.
  • Dragapult's ability Clear Body allows it to ignore stat changes from Landorus-T and Pecharunt.
  • Dragapult's Ghost typing allows it to safely attack without having to worry about getting hit by Counter from Defensive Ogerpon-W.
  • While Adamant nature allows Dragapult to deals maximum damage and allows it to have better odds against other Pokemon such as Metagross and Skeledirge, Jolly nature allows it to outspeed Spectrier, Darkrai, and Chien-Pao.
  • Dragapult struggles against Dark-, Dragon-, or Fairy-type Pokemon such as Urshifu-S, Primarina, and Speed Booster Energy Roaring Moon. Pokemon like Sylveon and Iron Valiant, which cover for Dragapult's Dark and Dragon weaknesses, and Scizor and Corviknight, which cover for Dragapult's Fairy and Dark weaknesses are good teammates.

Custap Berry.description:
• Custap Berry + Reversal allows Urshifu-S to blow past threats that would otherwise be an issue for it such as Choice Scarf Haxorus and Hisuian Goodra.
  • Wicked Blow hits Cresselia, Pecharunt, Spectrier, Iron Crown, and Metagross.
  • Endure is useful against Choice-locked Pokemon such as opposing Urshifu-S, so that your Urshifu-S can survive on 1 HP, go first the next turn thanks to Custap Berry, and fire back with a 200-Base Power Reversal.
  • Bulk Up is useful to set up against Corviknight, since the Defense boost means Urshifu-S doesn't take as much damage from its Body Press or Brave Bird, and the Attack boost means Wicked Blow does more damage; thanks to Wicked Blow's guaranteed critical hit, it also ignores possible Defense boosts from Iron Defense.
  • Sucker Punch can be used over Bulk Up to win against Choice Scarf Cresselia.
  • The EVs allow Urshifu-S to survive a Close Combat from Choice Scarf Haxorus as well as a Hyper Beam from Choice Specs Spectrier while also having enough Speed for non-Jolly Corviknight. The remaining EVs are put into Attack.
  • Urshifu-S can often struggle against Fairy- and Fighting-type Pokemon such as Sylveon, Iron Valiant, and Urshifu-R, so it appreciates having other Poison- and Fairy-type Pokemon such as Pecharunt and Primarina as teammates.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest helps Urshifu-S to survive special hits from Pokemon that it would usually struggle against, like defensive Iron Crown, Porygon-Z, and Volcarona.
  • Wicked Blow damages Iron Crown, Pecharunt, and Cresselia.
  • Close Combat hits non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra, both Ursaluna formes, and Porygon-Z.
  • Sucker Punch allows Urshifu-S to attack first against threats like Custap Berry Skeledirge and Spectrier in case it needs to do so.
  • Rock Tomb is utilized to have a mostly guaranteed matchup against Volcarona.
  • Counter helps against physically defensive Pokemon like Donphan; Urshifu-S can't deal much damage to them, but Counter helps it to mitigate this.
  • Its EV spread is designed so that it can always beat Porygon-Z. Its Speed EVs allow it to outspeed maximum Speed Choice Specs Porygon-Z, while its Special Defense investment enables it to survive a Hyper Beam from Modest Choice Scarf variants. The remaining EVs are invested into Attack.
  • Urshifu-S struggles heavily against Fairy-types like Iron Valiant and Sylveon. Due to this, Steel- and Poison-type Pokemon like Scizor and Iron Moth make for good partners.

Choice Band.description:
• Surging Strikes deals with Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Volcarona.
  • Close Combat targets Assault Vest Urshifu-S, non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, non-Choice Scarf Kyurem, and Registeel.
  • Iron Head is for non-Life Orb Alolan Ninetales, since Urshifu-R can get past Encore + Disable variants by ignoring Protect.
  • Poison Jab is for Whimsicott and non-bulky Primarina.
  • Thunder Punch 2HKOes opposing Urshifu-R without having to drop Urshifu-R's Defense with Close Combat.
  • Against Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B, Surging Strikes is the best option, since both can carry Chople Berry.
  • Since Urshifu-R struggles against Psychic- and Fairy-type Pokemon like Metagross, Iron Crown, and Iron Valiant, Pokemon such as Meowscarada, Volcanion, and Volcarona make for good teammates.

IronPress.description:
• The IronPress combination allows Urshifu-R to wall Pokemon it otherwise wouldn't be able to handle, like Metagross, while also dealing with common physical stalwarts like Ursaluna and Registeel.
  • Surging Strikes hits Volcarona, Landorus-T, and Rhyperior.
  • Taunt can be used to prevent foes like Registeel and non-Brave Bird Corviknight from setting up or using recovery moves.
  • Sitrus Berry allows Urshifu-R to usually survive two Psychic Fangs from Choice Band Metagross after an Iron Defense boost so it can respond with two +2 Body Press in return.
  • Urshifu-R can struggle with Grass- and Electric-type Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Zapdos, and as a result, partners like Raging Bolt are recommended.
  • Urshifu-R can struggle against special attackers like Spectrier and Porygon-Z due to its poor Special Defense, so Pokemon like Hisuian Goodra and Assault Vest Ursaluna can make for good partners.

Life Orb.description:
• Being an extremely fast and powerful Ghost-type with access to Calm Mind and Will-O-Wisp, Spectrier is able to flexibly set up on many different attackers.
  • After a Will-O-Wisp, Hex is Spectrier's strongest Ghost-type move. The doubled Base Power of Hex allows Spectrier to remain advantaged in Calm Mind wars against Cresselia and Iron Crown and against burned Pokemon that would otherwise be able to KO Spectrier such as Annihilape and Metagross.
  • Hyper Beam allows Spectrier to OHKO frail Pokemon such as Meowscarada and Haxorus.
  • Calm Mind allows Spectrier to tank moves from strong special attackers such as non-Assault Vest Volcanion and KO back after one or two Calm Mind boosts with Hyper Beam.
  • The Speed EVs let Spectrier outspeed all Meowscarada sets, while the Special Attack EVs let it OHKO standard Haxorus with Hyper Beam. The rest of the EVs are placed in Defense for the best odds against Choice Scarf Haxorus.
  • Spectrier struggles to deal with Pokemon that do not mind being burned such as Guts Ursaluna and Hisuian Goodra, anti-setup Pokemon like Volcarona and Primarina, faster Pokemon that can OHKO it such as Chien Pao and Dragapult, and Dark-type Pokemon such as Urshifu-S and Hoopa-U. Therefore, Pokemon like Primarina and Iron Valiant make great partners.

Choice Band.description:
• Earthquake is for Raging Bolt, Iron Crown, and non-Air Balloon Pecharunt.
  • Giga Impact is used for Choice Scarf Porygon-Z and non-Choice Band Azumarill.
  • Avalanche targets Landorus, Landorus-T, and Garchomp.
  • Gunk Shot is for Sylveon and Azumarill, while Low Kick is the best move against opposing Ursaluna, Ursaluna-B, and Air Balloon Heatran.
  • Bulletproof helps against Choice Specs Iron Valiant and some Hoopa-U sets, while Guts helps against Will-O-Wisp users like Volcarona, Spectrier, and Weakness Policy + Will-O-Wisp Dragapult.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Ursaluna to survive Hammer Arm from Choice Band Landorus-T, while the Special Defense EVs allow it to take Hyper Beam from Life Orb Sylveon. The remaining EVs are put in Attack.
  • Choice Band Ursaluna should click the most damaging move against its foe unless multiple moves OHKO, in which case it is best to click the most accurate of said choices. Against Substitute users like Volcarona, it is usually better to use Earthquake to avoid a recharge turn with Giga Impact.

Guts.description:
• With Guts, Ursaluna becomes an insanely threatening Pokemon capable of OHKOing a great portion of the metagame upon activation of its Flame Orb. Toxic Orb may alternatively be used to deal with Pokemon that learn Trick such as Cresselia.
  • After being burned, Facade is able to muscle through Pokemon that would otherwise deal with Choice Band Ursaluna such as Kee Berry Cresselia and is capable of OHKOing many frail Pokemon such as Sylveon.
  • Headlong Rush threatens KOs on Pokemon such as Skeledirge and Pecharunt.
  • Avalanche allows Ursaluna to respond to opposing Ground- and Dragon-type Pokemon that would get the first strike, being able to OHKO threats like Choice Band Landorus-T and Choice Scarf Haxorus.
  • Swords Dance allows Ursaluna to boost itself in matchups where it cannot immediately threaten a KO, overwhelming threats that focus on boosting themselves such as Iron Crown.
  • Taunt may be used to shut down matchups that could otherwise outplay Guts Ursaluna, such as against SubSeed Whimsicott.
  • The bulk EVs are used to survive Modest Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam without a boosting item and Choice Band Landorus-T's Hammer Arm. The rest of the EVs maximize Ursaluna's Attack.
  • While Guts Ursaluna has the ability to switch moves and disrupt defensive threats like Iron Crown, the lack of immediate firepower that Choice Band would grant can cause Ursaluna to lose some matchups like against slower non-Custap Berry Primarina.

Liechi Berry.description:
• Endure prevents Sneasler from getting OHKOed by foes such as Hoopa-U and Ursaluna while also activating Unburden and Liechi Berry as well as increasing the damage output of Reversal.
  • Gunk Shot hits Fairy-type foes such as Primarina and Sylveon along with Grass-types like Ogerpon-W and Serperior.
  • Reversal, paired with Endure, is Sneasler's strongest attack; at maximum power, it eliminates bulky foes such as Ursaluna as well as fast foes such as Greninja and Meowscarada.
  • Taunt enables Sneasler to shut down Pokemon that attempt to set up against it, such as Corviknight and Manaphy. Alternatively, Substitute can be used to deal with Choice Scarf Volcanion and Attack Booster Energy Roaring Moon, which are outsped by Jolly Sneasler.
  • An Adamant nature can be used to maximize Sneasler's damage output, threating foes such as Walking Wake. Alternatively, a Jolly nature allows Sneasler to outspeed fast threats such as Choice Specs Iron Valiant, Life Orb Greninja, Serperior, and Ogerpon-W.
  • It is suggested to pair Sneasler with Dark-types such as Urshifu-S, which are able to hit Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Cresselia, Iron Crown, Skeledirge, and Dragapult, which Sneasler is unable to handle.

Normal Gem.description:
• This set takes advantage of the combination of Normal Gem-boosted Fake Out and Unburden to reliably allow Sneasler to outpace the entire metagame.
  • Close Combat provides a more accurate option against matchups against Pokemon such as Meowscarada and Hoopa-U. It can also dispatch non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra and all but the most Defense-oriented Ursaluna.
  • Gunk Shot hits key metagame threats such as Primarina and Ogerpon-W.
  • Dire Claw's accuracy and chance to inflict crippling status effects provides a reliable STAB move in matchups where Sneasler needs to attack multiple times, such as against stall Zapdos, Diancie, and Whimsicott. Additionally, the second Poison-type STAB option allows Sneasler to reliably take on Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • Feint defeats Encore + Disable Iron Valiant, which can deny Sneasler its Unburden boost by using Protect against Fake Out. Note that Fake Out should still be used if the opposing Iron Valiant does not reveal a Speed Booster Energy set. The priority of Feint can also be used to prevent Custap Berry users, such as Primarina and Urshifu-S, from firing off a move after using Endure.
  • Acrobatics allows Sneasler to take on the mirror matchup most reliably as well as bulkier variants of Volcarona.
  • Adamant is highly preferred over Jolly for crucial damage rolls against Pokemon that Sneasler hits neutrally with its STAB moves such as Hoopa-U and Volcarona.
  • Sneasler falters against Ground-type Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Garchomp as well as bulky stall Pokemon such as Cresselia and Corviknight. Partners such as Alolan Ninetales or Ogerpon-W are capable of handling both.

Choice Band.description:
• Flower Trick demolishes Water-types such as Primarina, Urshifu-R, and Manaphy.
  • Knock Off crushes Psychic- and Ghost-types such as Cresselia, Espathra, and Skeledirge.
  • Triple Axel hits Dragon-types like Raging Bolt, Flying-types such as Zapdos and both Landorus formes, and Grass-types like opposing Meowscarada and Whimsicott super effectively.
  • Meowscarada's last moveslot is pretty flexible; Giga Impact is its overall strongest pick, taking down foes such as non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z and low-invested Ogerpon-W and Walking Wake; Play Rough deals with Fighting-types like Urshifu-S and Annihilape and is a better move against some Dragon-types, notably Walking Wake and Kyurem; Thunder Punch is a great option for Corviknight, against which Meowscarada would otherwise have a hard time; Low Kick hits Hisuian Goodra and Kyurem for more damage.
  • A Jolly nature ensures Meowscarada outspeeds Greninja, Serperior, Ogerpon-W, and non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Valiant, while an Adamant nature provides some additional firepower to this set, allowing feats such as OHKOing Custap Berry Skeledirge and most Metagross variants with Knock Off, Porygon-Z with Triple Axel, and Annihilape with Play Rough.
  • Meowscarada struggles against faster Pokemon like Speed Energy Booster Iron Valiant and Choice Scarf users such as Hoopa-U, so it appreciates partners that can deal with them like Hisuian Goodra, Pecharunt, and Corviknight.

Custap Berry.description:
• Skeledirge is a powerful Pokemon in 1v1 thanks to its combination of Custap Berry, Blaze, and Blast Burn, which allows it to melt past threats like Hisuian Goodra and Iron Hands after a Torch Song.
  • Torch Song allows Skeledirge to boost its Special Attack if it can survive a hit while also hitting Pokemon like Serperior and Whimsicott through Substitute.
  • Encore helps Skeledirge against Pokemon like Iron Valiant and Iron Crown, as they can sometimes use Encore on it themselves or start setting up on it. Encore is also helpful for Skeledirge in cases where it can guarantee itself to go into Custap Berry range, such as when opponents choose to use weaker moves against it due to the fear of Endure.
  • Endure allows Skeledirge to survive attacks from Pokemon like non-Assault Vest Landorus-T and offensive Ogerpon-W to then go next the second turn with Custap Berry and fire off a strong Blaze-boosted Blast Burn.
  • The HP and Defense investment allows Skeledirge to survive an Earthquake from Choice Band Iron Hands, the Special Defense investment makes it always tank a Dark Pulse from Choice Specs Porygon-Z, and the rest of the EVs are put into Special Attack.
  • Endure should be used wisely, as there are many Pokemon that can easily OHKO Skeledirge but may choose not to because of the threat of Endure and Blast Burn, like Choice Band Landorus-T and others like Spectrier.
  • Skeledirge may struggle against Dragon- and Water-types like Roaring Moon, Walking Wake, and Manaphy. Pokemon that can deal with these threats, such as Kyurem, Sylveon, and Meowscarada make for great partners.

Air Balloon.description:
• The powerful stallbreaking combination of Torch Song and Unaware breaks through practically any setup threat such as Volcarona or Cresselia with ease. It also allows Skeledirge to attack Weakness Policy users, namely Iron Crown and Metagross without fear.
  • Air Balloon allows Skeledirge to use Will-O-Wisp on physical attackers like Garchomp and Iron Hands without fear of Ground-type coverage, letting it stall them out with Slack Off.
  • Encore is useful against stall Pecharunt and to prevent non-Choice Band Ursaluna from using its Ground-type STAB moves.
  • Maximum HP and Defense EVs ensure that Skeledirge never loses to highly offensive variants of certain attackers, such as Garchomp and non-Encore Annihilape, that it is expected to check.
  • Because Encore itself is not affected by opposing Encore, Skeledirge performs favorably against common Encore + Disable users such as Alolan Ninetales and non-Spirit Break Speed Booster Iron Valiant. Skeledirge should always use Encore first and then alternate between Torch Song and Encore until an opposing Disable is used. After that, Skeledirge is free to use Will-O-Wisp and then continue the sequence to an eventual KO.
  • Choice Band Meowscarada and Hisuian Goodra can dispatch threats to Skeledirge such as Primarina and Raging Bolt while greatly appreciating its additional security against Ursaluna and Iron Crown, which they cannot always handle reliably.

Bulky Band.description:
• Choice Band gives Annihilape the extra power it needs to take down bulky threats like non-Air Balloon Volcanion, Garchomp, non-Chople Berry Ursaluna-B, and Raging Bolt.
  • Close Combat enables Annihilape to beat Ursaluna, Chien-Pao, Hisuian Goodra, Registeel, and Urshifu-S.
  • Earthquake helps Annihilape beat non-Choice Scarf Volcanion, non-Air Balloon Pecharunt, Iron Moth, and Assault Vest Metagross. *Outrage enables Annihilape to beat Raging Bolt, Substitute Roaring Moon, and Garchomp. *Gunk Shot allows Annihilape to beat non-Custap Berry Primarina, Sylveon, and Ogerpon-W.
  • This EV Spread enables Annihilape to live a Modest Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt Draco Meteor as well as an Acrobatics from Jolly Attack Booster Energy Roaring Moon. The Speed investment allows Annihilape to outspeed maximum Speed invested Primarina, Sylveon, and Hisuian Goodra.
  • Annihilape should use Outrage on the first turn against Roaring Moon, since Roaring Moon can use Substitute and OHKO with Acrobatics when Annihilape is at -1 Defense due to Close Combat. *Annihilape loses to Pokemon like Iron Crown and Fairy-types like Custap Berry Primarina, Custap Berry Sylveon, Iron Valiant, and Alolan Ninetales. It is advised that Annihilape be used alongside a Steel-type Pokemon like Assault Vest Metagross to address these weaknesses.

Weakness Policy.description:
• Weakness Policy Annihilape faces stiff competition from Urshifu-S as a Fighting-type Iron Crown check. Yet, in combination with the natural ambiguity that Annihilape has due its set variety, it carves out a legitimate niche in the metagame with better matchups against common Urshifu-S counters such as Choice Band Iron Valiant and Sitrus Berry Will-O-Wisp Volcanion.
  • Rage Fist is mandatory in order to KO Iron Crown if it opts to use Tachyon Cutter.
  • Low Sweep allows Annihilape to outspeed Timid Iron Crown and then follow up with a boosted Rage Fist or Encore while still being strong enough to 2HKO threats such as Ursaluna and Urshifu-S.
  • Low Sweep + Encore is a very potent anti-setup combination in general, effectively locking down Corviknight, Manaphy and, when combined with Bulk Up, Landorus-T.
  • The defensive EVs provide the best odds to survive Psychic and Psyshock from Special Attack Booster Energy Iron Crown.
  • Due to the strength of this set against stall Pokemon, Choice item users such as Primarina, Ursaluna, and Volcanion synergize well with Annihilape.
  • While proficient against its usual checks, this specific Annihilape set will often get overwhelmed by powerful neutral attackers such as Ogerpon-W and Raging Bolt. Hisuian Goodra and Haxorus both make good partners, as they can handle threats to Annihilape like Primarina and Meowscarada, and their respective extreme Special Defense and Attack stats make them hard to blanket check.

Booster Energy (Attack).description:
