• Booster Energy lets Iron Hands hit as hard as possible without getting locked into one move by Choice Band.
  • The given EV spread allows Iron Hands to live Choice Band Meowscarada's Play Rough and unboosted Modest Porygon-Z's Hyper Beam.
  • Supercell Slam and Close Combat do heavy damage to obvious targets such as Galarian Moltres and Volcanion as well as neutrally affected Pokemon such as Haxorus, Ogerpon-W and Assault Vest Hoopa-U.
  • Heavy Slam is vital coverage against Encore + Disable users like Iron Valiant and Alolan Ninetales. It also hits Protean Meowscarada using Play Rough and niche Fairy-types such as Diancie and Whimsicott.
  • Fake Out gives Iron Hands strong odds to KO non-bulky variants of Walking Wake.
  • Swords Dance is useful against Chople Berry Counter Hisuian Goodra and stall Pokemon like Corviknight and Manaphy.
  • Iron Hands has clear issues against Ground-types and also loses to setup Pokemon that can comfortably take its attacks such as Cresselia, Iron Crown, and defensive variants of Volcarona. Its Primarina matchup is also uneasy without Assault Vest. Therefore, Ogerpon-W makes for an exceptional partner thanks to its strong STAB moves and access to Encore.

Attack Booster.description:
• Outrage is Roaring Moon's most powerful STAB move against neutral threats like Hisuian Goodra, while also hitting other Dragon-types such as Raging Bolt and Walking Wake super effectively.
  • Knock Off hits both Psychic-types, such as Iron Crown, and Ghost-types, such as Skeledirge and Spectrier. Importantly, it removes the item from foes such as offensive Hoopa-U, which would otherwise KO Roaring Moon.
  • Acrobatics is a powerful move to hit foes such as non-physically defensive Ogerpon-W, bulkier Volcarona sets, and Fighting-types such as both Urshifu formes.
  • Substitute allows Roaring Moon to safely avoid a knockout from Draco Meteor users, such as Haban Berry Raging Bolt and non-Choice Band Hisuian Goodra. It further allows Roaring Moon to avoid stat dropping moves from foes such as Pecharunt.
  • Alternatively, Dragon Dance can be used to secure the knockout against bulkier foes, such as Weakness Policy Metagross, Annihilape, and bulkier Ogerpon-W sets.
  • The EV spread lets it survive a Focus Blast from Modest Hoopa-U, allowing it to beat all Hoopa-U sets by using Knock Off. The Speed EVs outspeed maximum Speed Ogerpon-W.

Encore + Disable.description:
• Iron Valiant's main attack is very interchangeable. Moonblast is the most reliable and is usually the one that works in the most matchups like opposing Iron Valiant and Walking Wake, while Low Kick can help it break through Steel-type Pokemon like Hisuian Goodra and Registeel, though, it's scared of Counter from the former.
  • The Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, with the remaining EVs going into Defense so it can bulk physical hits and fire back with its Encore + Disable setup.
  • To utilize Encore + Disable effectively, you usually have to use Protect on the first turn to scout the foe's first move. If you are certain it is a Choice-locked Pokemon, you can just use Disable on the second turn and force it to use Struggle, and if it utilizes a status move, you are free to use Encore on its move and attack with your main STAB move; otherwise, it is recommended to use Encore on the second turn to take a hit, then Protect on the third turn, then Disable on the fourth turn, and, once Encore is over, you use Encore again. This ensures 2 turns of Struggle from the foe, at which point Iron Valiant should be able to KO it. On more passive Pokemon that have moves that do little damage like Registeel, it sometimes can be better to opt out of using Protect and just use your main attack.
  • Iron Valiant fits best on teams that can cover their main weakness to Steel-type Pokemon; therefore, Fire-type Pokemon like Volcarona and Skeledirge make great teammates. In return, Iron Valiant can handle threats like Choice Specs Greninja and Choice Band Ursaluna. Iron Valiant also appreciates Pecharunt and Hisuian Goodra being extremely consistent against Fairy-types, as these can easily deal with them while it deals with Ground-type Pokemon like Great Tusk and the previously mentioned Ursaluna.

Choice Specs.description:
• Moonblast and Focus Blast are Iron Valiant's main STAB moves, OHKOing targets that are weak to them such as non-Assault Vest Raging Bolt, both Urshifu formes, and Flame Orb Ursaluna.
  • Thunderbolt's main use is to 2HKO Corviknight, which Iron Valiant's usual sets can't do much against, though it has to watch out for Expert Belt Corviknight.
  • Iron Valiant's last move varies depending on what its team needs. Psyshock takes care of Iron Moth, while Icy Wind can usually beat both Landorus formes, though it has to watch out for Assault Vest Landorus-T with Fly.
  • A Modest nature maximizes damage and ensures some OHKOs like non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra but for most matchups like non-bulky Ogerpon-W, Iron Moth, and non-Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake, it is better to run a Timid nature.
  • Iron Valiant's HP and Special Defense EVs let it survive a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt's Thunderclap so it's safe to OHKO back with Moonblast, with the remaining EVs used on Speed and Special Attack to maximize its ability to outspeed and threaten frail threats.
  • Iron Valiant really struggles to put a dent on Fairy-type Pokemon like Sylveon and Primarina, so Poison- and Steel-type Pokemon like Pecharunt and Hisuian Goodra can be really helpful to shut down these threats.
  • Iron Valiant can struggle with Psychic-types like Iron Crown and Metagross, as it can't do much damage to them, so Dark-types like Meowscarada, Darkrai, and Hoopa-U work as good partners for it.

Choice Band.description:
• Spirit Break OHKOes Haxorus, Hoopa-U, and both Urshifu formes.
  • Close Combat deals huge damage to non-Chople Berry Hisuian Goodra and Ursaluna, Registeel, Kyurem, non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, and non-Brave Bird or Iron Head Corviknight.
  • Ice Punch lets Iron Valiant deal with both Landorus formes, though it has a chance of not beating Fly Landorus-T.
  • Poison Jab helps against non-Kebia Berry Whimsicott and Serperior, while Liquidation can take care of frail and non-Passho Berry Volcarona.
  • Iron Valiant struggles against Psychic- and Fairy-type Pokemon like Iron Crown, Metagross, Primarina, and Sylveon, so Pokemon like Hoopa-U, Darkrai, and Pecharunt are really helpful. In return, Iron Valiant can help them deal with Fighting- and Ground-type Pokemon like Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and Landorus.
  • Iron Valiant also struggles to beat Water-type Pokemon like Manaphy, Azumarill, and bulky Ogerpon-W, so Pokemon like Zapdos and Raging Bolt can help with these threats, while Iron Valiant deals with the previously mentioned Ground-types along with Ice-type Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Kyurem.

Booster Energy (Special Attack).description:
• With a boost in Special Attack via Booster Energy, Walking Wake has the luxury of a power increase while also being able to change its moves during a battle if needed.
  • Draco Meteor KOes slower Dragon-types such as Raging Bolt and Adamant Haxorus. It also lets Walking Wake beat Pokemon like Volcanion and some Hoopa-U variants.
  • Hydro Pump OHKOes Pokemon weak to Water such as non-Assault Vest Landorus-T and Ursaluna, as well as being Walking Wake's best option versus Pokemon that resist Dragon, like Metagross.
  • Hurricane allows Walking Wake to beat Fighting-types such as both Urshifu formes, as well as Grass-types like Ogerpon-W and Rillaboom.
  • Aqua Jet is an important priority move for Walking Wake, allowing it to defeat Pokemon that may Endure a lethal move like Custap Berry Urshifu-S, Sneasler, and Ursaluna, and win versus Substitute + Reversal Sneasler.
  • The defensive EVs are used to let Walking Wake survive Assault Vest Urshifu-S's Close Combat into Sucker Punch and Choice Specs Volcanion's Hyper Beam. The Speed is used to let Walking Wake outspeed all Landorus-T, and the rest of the EVs are placed in Special Attack.
  • Because this set doesn't maximize its Speed, maximum Speed Kyurem, Garchomp, and Haxorus as well as other faster Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Dragapult can win against Walking Wake. A good Steel- or Fairy-type like Corviknight or Primarina can help alleviate the pressure Walking Wake faces from these threats.

Booster Energy (Speed).description:
• With a Speed boost, Walking Wake is able to catch faster Dragon-types like Dragapult and Choice Scarf Haxorus off guard. Notably, it also has a strong matchup into Iron Valiant, which is an extremely common and powerful partner with many Pokemon that Walking Wake handily wins against, such as Volcanion and Ursaluna.
  • Hydro Pump scores crucial KOs against Assault Vest Ursaluna and Spectrier. As this set lacks a damage-boosting item, the power of Draco Meteor against Dragon-types makes it necessary over other options.
  • Chilling Water is crucial against Ursaluna. It also allows Walking Wake to safely chip Chien-Pao, Meowscarada and Urshifu-R into range of one of its STAB moves.
  • Hurricane is threatening to Iron Valiant and Urshifu-S. While favored against most sets, Walking Wake will still lose to faster Spirit Break variants of the former and Assault Vest sets of the latter.
  • Running Flamethrower stifles Walking Wake's anti-meta traits but does increase its general consistency, providing a clean 3HKO against Assault Vest Metagross.
  • The EVs are meant to survive an Adamant Choice Band Ursaluna Giga Impact after Chilling Water. It also survives -1 Earthquake into -2 Giga Impact from Assault Vest Ursaluna.
  • Because of Hurricane's flimsy accuracy and losing matchups, it is highly suggested to not run Walking Wake as the only answer to Iron Valiant and both formes of Urshifu. Fairy-types such as Sylveon and Alolan Ninetales counter these Pokemon while taking advantage of Walking Wake's reliable coverage of Fire-types.
  • This Walking Wake set is ineffective against most Pokemon that rely on bulk, such as Corviknight, Cresselia, and Pecharunt. Special Attack Booster Energy Iron Crown is able to muscle past these threats while matching up well into Primarina, Walking Wake's most prevalent counter.

Offensive.description:
• Ogerpon-W is a very strong offensive threat with a wide movepool capable of adapting itself to a variety of threats in 1v1.
  • Power Whip hits opposing Water- and Ground-types like Primarina and Ursaluna. Wood Hammer may be used to not deal with Power Whip's 85% accuracy, though taking recoil may cause Ogerpon-W to lose some matchups that Power Whip would be a better fit for, such as against opposing Ogerpon-W.
  • Ivy Cudgel muscles through Fire- and Ground-types like Volcarona, Heatran, and Landorus-T.
  • Ogerpon-W's blisteringly fast base 110 Speed allows it to shut down many defensive threats that enjoy boosting their Defense stat such as Corviknight and Iron Crown by locking them into a status move with Encore.
  • Superpower may be used to secure KOs on threats that would otherwise survive Ogerpon-W's STAB attacks such as bulky Choice Specs Porygon-Z and non-Counter Hisuian Goodra.
  • U-turn can KO bulkier, slower Hoopa-U sets that would survive Ogerpon-W's other moves.
  • Knock Off can be used to outplay Custap Berry Pokemon such as Skeledirge and faster Choice Scarf users like Metagross.
  • Trailblaze lets Ogerpon-W get the jump on faster Pokemon that could potentially outplay it such as Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • Spiky Shield can be used to secure OHKOs against Pokemon like Custap Berry Skeledirge and can stop Fly from Landorus-T.
  • Ogerpon-W's Speed is maximized to outspeed Alolan Ninetales and Speed tie itself in the mirror matchup. The rest of the EVs are placed to maximize its Attack.
  • Because of Ogerpon-W's immense strength, versatility, and Speed, its moveset is completely flexible and can open a myriad of options for its partners. Unfortunately, offensive Ogerpon-W can be overwhelmed by threats that can survive an attack and KO it back, such as Haxorus, so partners that help Ogerpon-W overcome this issue like Sylveon and Iron Crown are helpful.

Charm.description:
• Charm + Synthesis allows Ogerpon-W to outlast slower physical attackers like Haxorus and Iron Hands. Synthesis can also help defeat Draco Meteor users like Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.
  • Ivy Cudgel is a reliable Water-type STAB move used to chip down the likes of Metagross and Skeledirge.
  • Power Whip is used primarily to take down other Water-types, most notably Primarina and Urshifu-R.
  • If some of these Pokemon are already well covered by a partner, Encore is worth considering. Encore can foil the plans of some setup Pokemon, such as Swords Dance Iron Hands, that would otherwise outlast Charm and then KO Ogerpon-W. Encore also allows for it to break through some stall Pokemon, such as Reflect + Calm Mind Cresselia.
  • 152 Speed EVs and a Jolly nature allow Ogerpon-W to outspeed Haxorus and Urshifu. The defensive investment gives the best chances to survive a Close Combat from Choice Band Urshifu, allowing Ogerpon-W to be sent in against both of its formes without having to guess at Team Preview.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Power Whip is for Primarina and non-Sap Sipper Azumarill and is the best option against non-positive Defense-natured Sylveon.
  • Ivy Cudgel is for non-Passho Berry Volcarona and Rhyperior.
  • Knock Off should be used against Spectrier and Porygon-Z.
  • Superpower guarantees the matchup against both Hisuian Goodra and bulkier Porygon-Z sets after Knock Off, while Encore allows Ogerpon-W to defeat Pokemon like Registeel.
  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-W to outspeed non-Choice Scarf Porygon-Z, while the HP and Special Defense EVs give it the best roll to survive Hyper Beam from Modest Porygon-Z after Ogerpon-W's Knock Off.
  • If Power Whip and another move both KO an opposing Pokemon, it is best to use the other move due to accuracy.
  • Against slower Pokemon that attempt to stall out Ogerpon-W, Encore can be used to lock them into a status move.
  • Knock Off can also be used in some matchups to remove an opposing Custap Berry on the turn that Pokemon like Custap Berry Sylveon use Endure.

SubSeed.description:
• Maximum Speed is to outspeed everything Ogerpon-W can, including non-Choice Scarf Landorus-T and Manaphy.
  • The Defense EVs let Ogerpon-W survive Choice Band Metagross's Psychic Fangs, while the Special Defense EVs let it take Ursaluna-B's combo of Blood Moon and Vacuum Wave.
  • Ogerpon-W should use Leech Seed turn one and then alternate between Spiky Shield and Substitute until the foe is KOed or is within range of Ogerpon-W's attacks.
  • Without Spiky Shield, Ogerpon-W relies more on its offensive capabilities. After using Leech Seed, it should use Substitute until it's able to KO foes with either Power Whip or Ivy Cudgel.
  • Leech Seed and Substitute are standard for the strategy. While Spiky Shield isn't mandatory, it is usually used to increase healing from Leech Seed and to stall out the foe's HP.
  • One or two attacking moves are used; Ivy Cudgel is better for hitting Fire-, Ground-, and Rock-types like Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Rhyperior for super effective damage and is better against IronPress sets from Pokemon like Registeel and Corviknight because of Ivy Cudgel's higher crit rate. Power Whip's main advantage is that it is better against Water-types, like Primarina and Manaphy.

Defensive.description:
• This Ogerpon-W takes a more defensive route thanks to its decent bulk and access to Counter in order to flip otherwise losing matchups, such as against non-Triple Axel Meowscarada.
  • Power Whip hits Water-type Pokemon such as Primarina super effectively and is Ogerpon-W's best option against neutral matchups like Sylveon.
  • Ivy Cudgel threatens Fire- and Ground-type Pokemon such as Skeledirge and Landorus-T.
  • Counter allows defensive Ogerpon-W to retaliate against physical foes that would either threaten to KO it or feel that a physical attack is their best move against offensive Ogerpon-W sets, such as non-Triple Axel Choice Band Meowscarada and opposing Ogerpon-W. Alternatively, Knock Off may be used to remove Custap Berry from Pokemon such as Skeledirge.
  • U-turn is Ogerpon-W's best option against non-defensive Hoopa-U, since it gets OHKOed. Alternatively, Encore is useful to lock down a slower foe focused on boosting their stats, such as Cresselia and defensive Iron Crown, or to outplay Endure Custap Berry sets from Pokemon such as Sylveon and Skeledirge.
  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-W to outspeed Hoopa-U whereas the HP and Defense EVs give Ogerpon-W the best rolls against Adamant Choice Band Meowscarada.
  • Defensive Ogerpon-W won't have the firepower to threaten Pokemon like Fast Choice Specs Porygon-Z, Bulky Hoopa-U, and Ursaluna, so teammates that can cover this weakness such as Corviknight are appreciated.

Haban Berry.description:
• Thunderbolt is the main Electric-type STAB move, but Thunder makes Raging Bolt more reliable against Primarina, as Thunder can OHKO it, so you don't have to worry about potential Weakness Policy or Encore after using Calm Mind or Charge. Thunderbolt should be used when it does neutral or super effective damage against frailer foes like Primarina, Corviknight, and Metagross without an Assault Vest. Against foes that can survive Draco Meteor followed by Thunderclap like Hoopa-U and Urshifu-S, it is safer to use Thunderbolt or Thunder into Draco Meteor.
  • Draco Meteor hits Electric-resistant foes like Rillaboom and should be used against bulkier foes like Hoopa-U and Skeledirge. It also 2HKOes Unaware Skeledirge.
  • Thunderclap is a priority move that helps to KO low HP Pokemon like non-Assault Vest Metagross after one use of Thunderbolt. Draco Meteor into Thunderclap does slightly more damage than Thunderbolt into Thunderclap against neutral targets, but Thunder into Thunderclap does more. Thunderclap also counters Custap Berry users like Primarina and Hoopa-U by attacking on the turn they use their Custap Berry.
  • Calm Mind and Charge are both here to boost Raging Bolt's power and special bulk. Both moves especially help against Primarina, though Charge is more reliable against it and Calm Mind is useful in more matchups like against Rillaboom, Iron Hands, and Spectrier.
  • Haban Berry allows Raging Bolt to win against Dragon-types such as Walking Wake, as it can OHKO them after surviving a Dragon-type move. However, if those Dragon-types are holding a Haban Berry, Raging Bolt can't OHKO them and is 2HKOed back.

Booster Energy (Special Attack).description:
• Thunderbolt is Raging Bolt's most consistent STAB attack and beats Primarina, non-Assault Vest Metagross, and Volcanion.
  • Draco Meteor is Raging Bolt's strongest STAB attack and should be used against Skeledirge.
  • Thunderclap allows Raging Bolt to get KOs after using Thunderbolt and Draco Meteor and helps in matchups against some Hoopa-U sets as well as against Custap Berry users like Primarina and the Urshifu formes.
  • Taunt allows Raging Bolt to beat Pecharunt and Ogerpon-W.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Raging Bolt to survive the Choice Band Urshifu formes' Close Combat, while the Special Defense EVs allow it to survive a Hyper Beam from Timid Porygon-Z. The Speed EVs allow Raging Bolt to outspeed Modest Primarina. The remaining EVs are put in Special Attack to maximize power for best odds against specially defensive Primarina.
  • Draco Meteor into Thunderclap is stronger than Thunderbolt into Thunderclap, so in matchups where there is no recovery from the foe, such as against non-Sitrus Berry Annihilape, it is better to use Draco Meteor into Thunderclap.

Fast Weakness Policy.description:
• Fast Weakness Policy Iron Crown aims to switch up otherwise disadvantageous matchups such as Haxorus as well as Choice Band Ground-types such as Landorus-T by boosting itself with Iron Defense, then obtaining a Weakness Policy boost to threaten an OHKO on the next turn with Stored Power.
  • Tachyon Cutter is Iron Crown's best Steel-type STAB move, being able to immediately pressure Fairy-Type Pokemon such as Iron Valiant and Sylveon. Tachyon Cutter has other niches in breaking foes' Substitute, such as against SubSeed Ogerpon-W and Serperior.
  • Upon activation of Weakness Policy, Stored Power's Base Power increases by 80. Combined with any prior boosts Iron Crown may have obtained, this makes Stored Power its strongest Psychic-type STAB option.
  • Psyshock can be used to disrupt the matchup versus other Calm Mind users that resist Stored Power such as opposing Iron Crown and Cresselia, albeit using Psyshock may miss out on important KOs that Stored Power would otherwise obtain.
  • Psychic Noise may be used to prevent recovery moves from Pokemon such as Cresselia that would otherwise be able to deal with Iron Crown. Psychic Noise also deals additional damage to Iron Valiant and Alolan Ninetales compared to Iron Crown's other Psychic-type options.
  • Calm Mind is used in matchups versus special attacking Pokemon such as Primarina and Cresselia in order to boost up Iron Crown's Special Attack and Special Defense to a point where it does not take much damage from their attacks while threatening KOs with Tachyon Cutter and Stored Power.
  • The EVs are used to outspeed maximum Speed Haxorus and to tie the mirror matchup versus opposing Iron Crown. The bulk is meant to tank an Adamant Choice Band Great Tusk Headlong Rush after one Iron Defense.
  • An alternative EV spread of 96 HP / 112 Def / 48 SpA / 252 Spe with a Timid Nature can be used to have a slightly better chance against Donphan with Tachyon Cutter after a Weakness Policy boost while still surviving Choice Band Great Tusk's Headlong Rush.

Defensive Weakness Policy.description:
• Defensive Weakness Policy Iron Crown uses Iron Defense and Calm Mind to boost its defenses to survive strong hits and KO back with Weakness Policy-boosted Stored Power.
  • Stored Power obtains a massive boost in Base Power when combined with Weakness Policy and stat-boosting moves.
  • Alternatively, Psyshock can be used for matchups Pokemon that have enough Special Defense to not be threatened by Stored Power, such as Cresselia and Pokemon that Iron Crown can't boost in front of like Iron Valiant..
  • Tachyon Cutter is hits Fairy-types such as Sylveon and Iron Valiant, and can break Substitute from Pokemon such as Serperior.
  • Calm Mind is used for matchups where boosting Special Attack and Special Defense is necessary, such as against Assault Vest Ursaluna-B.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Iron Crown to have a 75% chance to survive Adamant Choice Band Meowscarada's Knock Off in order to kill it with +2 Tachyon Cutter, as well as having favorable rolls to survive two Choice Band Ursaluna's Earthquake to boost with Iron Defense up to +4 and KO with Stored Power. The remaining EVs are placed in Speed for the mirror matchup and to base 50 speed Pokemon such as Ursaluna.
  • 36 Speed EVs can be used instead to outspeed Max Speed Primarina.
  • While this set is able to bulk many attacks, it is notably slower than faster Choice Band users like Landorus-T, making Defensive Iron Crown lose the matchup against them. Faster teammates that can deal with these Pokemon are ideal, such as attackers like Meowscarada.

Specially Defensive Weakness Policy.description:
• This specially defensive EV spread allows Weakness Policy Iron Crown to take special hits from very powerful special attackers such as Timid Choice Specs Darkrai, Raging Bolt, and Choice Specs Dragapult.
  • Psyshock is vital for matchups such as Calm Mind Raging Bolt, Iron Valiant, and Alolan Ninetales, as it helps hit the weaker physical side on the former and assists against Disable variants on the latter two.
  • The Defense EVs let Iron Crown survive Adamant Choice Band Knock Off from Meowscarada, while the Special Defense is enough to survive two Thunderbolts into a Thunderclap from Raging Bolt after a Calm Mind boost, since it would use Taunt on Iron Crown on the first turn. The Special Attack investment is enough to OHKO Haxorus with Tachyon Cutter after the Special Defense drop from Close Combat.
  • This Iron Crown set can struggle a lot against opposing Iron Crown due to the lack of Stored Power and matches up poorly against common Fire- and Ground-types and other miscellaneous threats like Hoopa-U and Corviknight, so it's recommended to utilize strong partners such as Air Balloon Volcanion and Ogerpon-W.

Special Attack Booster Energy.description:
• Calm Mind allows Iron Crown to compete with Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Cresselia, and opposing Iron Crown.
  • Psyshock enables Iron Crown to hit specially defensive foes, empowers it against Calm Mind users such as Weakness Policy Iron Crown and Clear Amulet Cresselia, and is important against Alolan Ninetales.
  • Tachyon Cutter exerts pressure on Fairy-type foes like Iron Valiant and Sylveon.
  • Focus Blast lets Iron Crown take on foes including Ursaluna-B and Hisuian Goodra. Alternatively, Psychic Noise can be used to check foes that rely on recovery moves, especially Pecharunt and Clear Amulet Cresselia. Moreover, Stored Power + Calm Mind allows Iron Crown to handle foes like Manaphy. Finally, Psychic allows Iron Crown to deal increased damage to foes such as Iron Hands and Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.
  • The bulk EVs allow Iron Crown to survive Knock Off from Adamant Choice Band Meowscarada and Hydro Cannon from Timid Choice Specs Primarina, with the rest of the EVs being put into Special Attack.
  • Primarina is a great partner for Iron Crown, since Iron Crown is weak to Ground- Fire- and Dark-type attacks from foes like Landorus, Volcarona, and Urshifu-S; in return, Iron Crown provides an immunity to Poison. On top of this, Iron Crown's weakness to Ghost-type attacks can be remedied by using other Dark-types, such as Roaring Moon.

Air Balloon.description:
• Malignant Chain can threaten common Fairy- and Grass-type Pokemon like Iron Valiant and Ogerpon-W. Its high poison chance can also wear down bulky Pokemon without relying on Curse.
  • Curse lets Pecharunt whittle down any foe behind Substitute regardless of typing, including Registeel and SubSeed Ogerpon-W.
  • The combination of Parting Shot and Recover lets Pecharunt neutralize virtually all non-Taunt, neutrally effective attackers like Iron Hands and non-Choice Specs Primarina while keeping itself healthy.
  • The Speed investment lets Pecharunt outspeed neutral-natured base 60 Speed Pokemon like Primarina and Maximum investment base 50 Speed Pokemon like Donphan and Ursaluna. The remaining investment is in HP and Defense for maximum bulk for powerful Ground-type attackers like Assault Vest Landorus-T.
  • Air Balloon prevents an opposing Ground-type move from being used on Pecharunt once , which can completely shut down Choice-locked Ground-types like Choice Band Landorus-T and Choice Band Ursaluna or can provide an opportunity for a Parting Shot to be used on Pokemon like Assault Vest Ursaluna.
  • Against SubSeed Ogerpon-W, Curse shouldn't be used until after Parting Shot to minimize the damage from Ivy Cudgel so that Curse can be used safely.
  • Despite Air Balloon, Pecharunt still struggles with Ground-types like Landorus-I, Life Orb Landorus-T, and or Attack Booster Great Tusk, so pairing it with a Water- or Ice-type like Primarina or Chien-Pao can be helpful.

Leftovers.description:
• Malignant Chain can seriously threaten Iron Valiant and Ogerpon-W. It also has the added bonus of having a high chance of poisoning which can wear down bulky Pokemon without relying on Curse, and it can also trigger Poison Puppeteer to provide decent odds to win otherwise losing matches with confusion.
  • Curse lets Pecharunt whittle down any foe behind Substitute regardless of typing, including Body Press Corviknight, Registeel, and SubSeed Ogerpon-W.
  • The combination of Parting Shot and Recover lets Pecharunt neutralize virtually all non-Taunt, neutrally effective attackers like non-Choice Specs Primarina and Choice Scarf Haxorus while keeping Pecharunt healthy.
  • The Speed investment lets Pecharunt outspeed Body Press and PP stall Corviknight. The remaining EVs are in HP and Special Defense for overall bulk.
  • Leftovers provides consistent healing in every matchup but also lets Pecharunt avoid being PP stalled by Taunt + Body Press Corviknight. Leftovers is also chosen over Black Sludge to continue to provide healing after a Soak from Bellibolt.
  • Against most Pokemon, Parting Shot should be used early to mitigate damage. Even against Encore Primarina, as after a few Parting Shots, Primarina won't be able to do substantial damage and Pecharunt will PP stall Encore out.
  • Against SubSeed Ogerpon-W, Curse shouldn't be used until after Parting Shot has been used to minimize the damage from Ivy Cudgel so that Curse can be used safely.
  • Against Volcarona and other Pokemon that may be able to OHKO Pecharunt, it's better to use Malignant Chain instead and play for a confusion from Poison Puppeteer.

Maranga Berry.description:
• This Pecharunt set searches to maximize its weak Special Defense to wall common threats such as Choice Specs users like Kyurem and Raging Bolt while still dealing with other common threats like Ogerpon-W and Primarina.
  • Malignant Chain threatens all sorts of Fairy- and Grass-type Pokemon like Serperior, Whimsicott, and Sylveon, with the chance of badly poisoning the target being a huge threat for any Pokemon.
  • Curse helps Pecharunt to not get walled by the likes of Registeel, as it often struggles to deal with Steel-types on its own while also helping against Pokemon that set up Substitute like Ogerpon-W.
  • Parting Shot helps it deal with special attackers like the previously mentioned Choice Specs Kyurem while also helping it against physical attackers like Iron Hands.
  • Recover is a great tool that helps it do everything that was previously mentioned with great longevity. It also helps when it needs to activate Maranga Berry on the first turn when the opposing Pokemon deals too much damage pre-Maranga Berry boost like Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt.
  • Its Speed EVs are meant to let it outspeed Modest Primarina, with the rest invested into its Special Defense and HP for stalling.
  • Pecharunt is usually found on teams that value its defensive capabilities, stalling potential, and Poison typing, so it's usually paired with offensive Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and both Urshifu formes.

Clear Amulet.description:
• This Pecharunt set makes the best out of its combination of Parting Shot and Clear Amulet to wall any Pokemon with moves that can drop stats, like Fake Tears Sylveon, Acid Spray Hisuian Goodra, and Icy Wind Primarina while still dealing with other common threats like Ogerpon-W.
  • Malignant Chain is capable of threatening Grass- and Fairy-type PokÃ©mon like Ogerpon-W, Whimsicott, and Sylveon, with the 50% chance to badly poison the target being able to work on all sorts of Pokemon when combined with Poison Puppeteer's confusion.
  • Curse helps Pecharunt beat Hisuian Goodra, the common Registeel, and Substitute users like Ogerpon-W.
  • Parting Shot helps Pecharunt deal with special attackers like the previously mentioned Hisuian Goodra, Sylveon, and Primarina without fearing Encore from the last one while also helping it against physical attackers like Iron Hands.
  • Recover is an important tool that helps Pecharunt do everything that was previously mentioned with great consistency.
  • Pecharunt's Speed EVs outspeed Modest Primarina, with the rest invested into its Special Defense and HP for stalling.
  • Pecharunt is mostly found in teams that value its stalling prowess and important Poison typing, which helps it deal with Fairy-type Pokemon, so it's usually paired with offensive Pokemon like Hoopa-U and Primarina.
